original: bstan zhes rgol bar byed pa la /
analyzed: bstan zhes rgol bar byed pa la /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas /
translated: “O sons of the lineage, after I pass into parinirvana,

analyzed: khyed rnams kyis dam pa'i chos rnams bsdu bar bya ste //
translated: you should compile the excellent Dharma.🔽At the beginning of all of them, say ‘Thus have I heard at one time.’

original: thams cad kyi dang por 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes bya ba byos shig ces gsungs la /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dang por 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes bya ba byos shig ces gsungs la /
translated: At the beginning of all of them, you should say, “Thus have I heard at one time.”🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: And in order to teach that the Bhagavan is in a nirvana that is not a resting place,

original: de bas na rtag tu bzhugs zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'di nyid kyis mngon no //
analyzed: de bas na rtag tu bzhugs zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'di nyid kyis mngon no //
translated: it is evident that he is always present.

original: gzhan dag na re 'khor los sgyur ba chen po mngon sum du ston par gyur pas rgyud shlo ka khri nyis stong sum brgya pa gsungs pa las stong nyis brgya pa 'di ni rgyud phyi ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'khor los sgyur ba chen po mngon sum du ston par gyur pas rgyud shlo ka khri nyis stong sum brgya pa gsungs pa las stong nyis brgya pa 'di ni rgyud phyi ma yin te /
translated: Others say: The great cakravartin manifested and taught the tantra in twelve thousand three hundred ślokas. This tantra in twelve hundred ślokas is the later tantra.

original: de bas na der dang po rtsom pa na gleng gzhi grags zin pas 'dir yang ma smras so zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: de bas na der dang po rtsom pa na gleng gzhi grags zin pas 'dir yang ma smras so zhes 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, when it is first composed, since the introduction is already known, it is not stated here.

original: de la chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag ni brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa dang dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa dag yod na /
analyzed: de la chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag ni brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa dang dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa dag yod na /
translated: In this regard, if the person who follows the Dharma has the subject matter, the connection, the purpose, and the ultimate purpose,

original: 'jug par 'gyur bas 'dir de dag bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur bas 'dir de dag bstan par bya ste /
translated: then he will engage in it. Therefore, those should be taught here.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma'i sgyu ma'i bde ba'i mchog dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma'i sgyu ma'i bde ba'i mchog dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: Here, the Blessed One, Vajrasattva, who is the nature of all things, is the subject matter, the union of all buddhas, the supreme bliss of the magical net of the dakinis.

original: de ston pa'i tshig rgyud 'di ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa'i tshig rgyud 'di ni brjod pa'o //
translated: This tantra, which teaches that, is the expression.

original: de bas na brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa'i mtshan nyid du 'brel pa ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa'i mtshan nyid du 'brel pa ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the connection between the subject matter and the expression is the connection.

original: der yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya'i 'gro ba rnams dga' bar bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: der yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya'i 'gro ba rnams dga' bar bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the purpose is to delight the beings to be tamed by the Blessed One.

original: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa sgrub pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba med pa'i rim pas mthar phyin par nus shing /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa sgrub pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba med pa'i rim pas mthar phyin par nus shing /
translated: One should understand that the ultimate purpose is the ability to perfect the stage of the means of accomplishment and the object of accomplishment, such as entering the maṇḍala, and so on, without incompleteness.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //🔽da ni rgyud 'di'i rtog pa bcu'i bdag nyid las dang po de kho na nyid snang ba dam pa'i yul la 'jug pa ye shes kyi phyag rgya brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid sdud par byed pa bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes dang por gnas phun sum tshogs
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o // da ni rgyud 'di'i rtog pa bcu'i bdag nyid las dang po de kho na nyid snang ba dam pa'i yul la 'jug pa ye shes kyi phyag rgya brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid sdud par byed pa bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes dang por gnas phun sum tshogs
translated: The characteristic of actualizing one’s own essence is the ultimate purpose.

original: pa bstan pa la 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa bstan pa la 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in this tantra, the first of the ten topics is the Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi’s summary of the nature of the chapter on the gnosis mudra that enters the field of the sacred appearance of reality, in order to enter the perfect place at the beginning.

original: sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, he declares “the hero” and so on.

original: sems dpa' @59b sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos //
analyzed: sems dpa' @59b sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos //
translated: “The hero is the actuality of all buddhas.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems can rnams kyi don la shin tu chags pas na sems dpa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems can rnams kyi don la shin tu chags pas na sems dpa'o //
translated: And so on. Since he is very attached to the purpose of sentient beings, he is a hero.

original: lha thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /
translated: Since he is the very essence of all the deities,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos po mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid pas na rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos po mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid pas na rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: he is Vajrasattva, the indivisible pristine consciousness of the nature of all buddhas.

original: mchog tu yang bde ba dang yid bde ba'i ngo bo nyid pas bde ba'i mchog go //🔽bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa dang / nang du yang dag 'dus pa mdzad par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: mchog tu yang bde ba dang yid bde ba'i ngo bo nyid pas bde ba'i mchog go // bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa dang / nang du yang dag 'dus pa mdzad par gyur pa'am /
translated: Since he is the very essence of supreme bliss and mental bliss, he is the supreme bliss.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa la sba bar bya ba yin pas na gsang ba pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa la sba bar bya ba yin pas na gsang ba pa'o //
translated: Since he is the supreme bliss, and so on, he is the secret one, because he is the one to be hidden from the śrāvakas, and so on.

original: thams cad kyi rab tu gyur pas na mchog go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rab tu gyur pas na mchog go //
translated: Since he is the best of all, he is the supreme.

original: nyes pa ma lus dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: nyes pa ma lus dang bral ba'am /
translated: Since he is free from all faults,

original: rdo rje lha mo dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i dgyes pa'i gnas skabs nyid kyis na dgyes pa na'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lha mo dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i dgyes pa'i gnas skabs nyid kyis na dgyes pa na'o //
translated: he is the one who is delighted in the state of union with the vajra goddess.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'am /
translated: Since he is the very essence of all tathāgatas,🔽he is the one who is delighted in the state of union with the vajra goddess.

original: nam mkha'i khams su gtogs pa thams cad mnyam pas na /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams su gtogs pa thams cad mnyam pas na /
translated: Since he is the one who is delighted in the state of union with the vajra goddess,🔽he is the one who is delighted in the state of union with the vajra goddess.

original: thams cad bdag nyid de dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gzhal yas khang du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rtag tu bzhugs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid de dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gzhal yas khang du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rtag tu bzhugs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: All of this is the nature of the glorious Vajrasattva's celestial mansion, and the Bhagavat Vajrasattva always resides there.

original: bzhi po de dag kyang rim pa bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag kyang rim pa bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach those four in sequence,

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //

analyzed: bdag nyid rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs par bsgoms pa las byung bas na rang byung ste /

analyzed: de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas thams kyi rang bzhin no //

analyzed: bla na med pa'i dbang phyug dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The Bhagavat, because it is endowed with unsurpassed lordship.

original: de nyid kyis na sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sems dpa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the hero.

original: gnyis pa med pas na gcig bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa med pas na gcig bu'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //

original: mkha' 'gro sgyu ma bde ba'i mchog / ces bya ste de nyid bde ba'i mchog tu bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro sgyu ma bde ba'i mchog / ces bya ste de nyid bde ba'i mchog tu bshad pa yin no //
translated: The supreme bliss of the dakinis' magic is explained as the supreme bliss itself.

translated: If one enters the assembly of goddesses in this way, it will be defiled. To dispel this notion, it is said without attachment, etc.

original: chags pa med ces bya ba ni chags pa dang bral ba ni nyan thos kyi byang chub la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa med ces bya ba ni chags pa dang bral ba ni nyan thos kyi byang chub la sogs pa'o //
translated: Without attachment means free from attachment to the enlightenment of the disciples, etc.

original: dbu mar zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i thabs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: dbu mar zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i thabs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: In the middle means in the method of practice, the wisdom of non-duality.

original: de dag thams cad kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: All of these are not apprehended,

original: don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //🔽lha mo rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro // lha mo rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: because ultimately they are without intrinsic nature.🔽In order to teach the reply of the goddesses that there is no defilement, it is said:

original: bud med kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bud med kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: All women, etc.

original: bud med thams cad kyi sgyu ma ni rjes su zhugs pa yang yin pas na 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyag rgya yin no //
analyzed: bud med thams cad kyi sgyu ma ni rjes su zhugs pa yang yin pas na 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyag rgya yin no //
translated: The illusion of all women is also included in this, so this is the seal of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ni gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ni gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to clarify just that, he says, “This is nondual,” and so forth.

original: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The two are the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de med pas na gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pas na gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Since they do not exist, it is nondual.

original: 'di gnyis kyis 'gro zhing phyin pas na theg pa ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis 'gro zhing phyin pas na theg pa ste /
translated: Since one goes and arrives by means of these two, it is a vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is the great vehicle of the bodhisattva, together with the result of the stage of buddhahood.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa las phul du byung bas na mchog go //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa las phul du byung bas na mchog go //
translated: Since it is superior to the vehicles of the śrāvakas and so on, it is supreme.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha mo dang bcas pa'i yang yod dam med ces bya ba la sogs pa rang gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas don yod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha mo dang bcas pa'i yang yod dam med ces bya ba la sogs pa rang gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas don yod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the meaning of “is it existent or nonexistent?” and so on, with regard to Vairocana and so on, together with the goddesses, is known by means of one’s own perfection of wisdom.

original: yang na bud med thams cad kyi sgyu ma'i phyag rgya ni bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa yin pa las rigs kyi tshogs gcig par byas so //
analyzed: yang na bud med thams cad kyi sgyu ma'i phyag rgya ni bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa yin pa las rigs kyi tshogs gcig par byas so //
translated: Or else, the illusory mudra of all women is the great seal of supreme bliss, etc., and they are made into a single group of families.

original: gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam pas 'di'i ngo bo nyid ston pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam pas 'di'i ngo bo nyid ston pa ste /
translated: By “nondual,” etc., he teaches its reality by way of the ultimate.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das don dam par gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das don dam par gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the Lord is the reality of nondual intuition in the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob tu ni gdul bya'i dbang du 'di ni sgyu ma'i phyag rgyar sprul te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni gdul bya'i dbang du 'di ni sgyu ma'i phyag rgyar sprul te /
translated: But conventionally, in accordance with the disciples, he is emanated as an illusory seal.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis kyang sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba yang dag par bstan pa yin @60b no ;
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis kyang sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba yang dag par bstan pa yin @60b no ;
translated: These two aspects are also taught as the union with all the Buddhas.

original: / gang zhig 'di ston na ci thabs gzhan dag gis sems can gyi don bya ba med dam zhe na /
analyzed: / gang zhig 'di ston na ci thabs gzhan dag gis sems can gyi don bya ba med dam zhe na /
translated: If he teaches this, is there no benefit for sentient beings by other means?

original: de'i phyir sgyu ma dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyu ma dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore he says, “All illusions,” etc.

original: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad pas //
analyzed: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad pas //
translated: All illusions are created by the power of causes and conditions.

original: zhes bya ba las sprul pa thams cad kyi nang na bud med kyis gyu ma ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba las sprul pa thams cad kyi nang na bud med kyis gyu ma ste /
translated: Among all emanations, the female is the best.

original: bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni rab tu khyab par che ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni rab tu khyab par che ste /
translated: The mudra of supreme bliss and so forth is very pervasive.

original: des gdul bar bya ba rnams la rim gyis gong ma'i 'bras bu ster cing /
analyzed: des gdul bar bya ba rnams la rim gyis gong ma'i 'bras bu ster cing /
translated: By that, those to be tamed are gradually given higher results.

original: bla na med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i ngo bo rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang thob par byed pas shin tu khyad par du 'phags par gyur te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i ngo bo rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang thob par byed pas shin tu khyad par du 'phags par gyur te /
translated: Since it causes the attainment of the state of Vajrasattva, the essence of unexcelled bliss and mental satisfaction, it is very special.

original: de bas na de nyid nye bar bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na de nyid nye bar bstan te /
translated: Therefore, that is taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo bya ba thams cad dang bral ba la rgyu gang gis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo bya ba thams cad dang bral ba la rgyu gang gis na /
translated: The Bhagavān Vajrasattva is the essence of nondual wisdom, free from all activity. By what cause🔽is he like this, special?

original: 'di ltar khyad par du gyur ce na ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par du gyur ce na ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The nature of the cause is taught by “naturally” and so forth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngo bo nyid kyis lhun gyis grub cing grub zin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis lhun gyis grub cing grub zin pa'o //
translated: The nature of the cause is naturally spontaneous and already accomplished.

original: rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: By what cause?

original: mthu dag gis te bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi che ba'i bdag nyid rang nyid kyis bsam zhing 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: mthu dag gis te bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi che ba'i bdag nyid rang nyid kyis bsam zhing 'dod pa ste /
translated: By the power of the great nature of the accumulations of merit and knowledge, one's own wishes and desires,

original: des bdag nyid kyi smon lam la brten pa'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: des bdag nyid kyi smon lam la brten pa'i bar gyis so //
translated: and by the power of one's own prayers.

original: de ltar 'di'i rgyu'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan nas 'bras bu che ba'i bdag nyid nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i rgyu'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan nas 'bras bu che ba'i bdag nyid nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught the greatness of the cause of this [perfection of wisdom], in order to teach the greatness of the result,

original: 'jig rten gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, The three worlds... and so on.

original: 'jig rten gsum ni sa 'og sa steng sa bla'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum ni sa 'og sa steng sa bla'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The three worlds have the characteristic of the underworld, the earth, and the heavens.

original: bud med 'dis zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa sgrub par brtson pa'i bud med do //
analyzed: bud med 'dis zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa sgrub par brtson pa'i bud med do //
translated: This woman... refers to a woman who is striving to accomplish supreme bliss and so on.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'am sgyu ma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'am sgyu ma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: By this... refers to the perfection of wisdom or the illusory seal.

original: gus par byed pa zhes bya ba ni che ba'i bdag nyid can du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gus par byed pa zhes bya ba ni che ba'i bdag nyid can du byed pa'o //
translated: Paying homage... means making her into a great being.

original: ci dka' ba spyod pa rnams 'grub par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci dka' ba spyod pa rnams 'grub par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, are those who practice austerities successful or not?

original: rnyed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnyed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says gain, etc.

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa la mngon par spyod bzhin du yang 'grub par 'gyur na rnyed pa la sogs pa yongs su spong ba la lta ci smos te /
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa la mngon par spyod bzhin du yang 'grub par 'gyur na rnyed pa la sogs pa yongs su spong ba la lta ci smos te /
translated: If one is successful even while engaged in the pursuit of gain, etc., what need is there to mention the complete abandonment of gain, etc.?

original: gang gi phyir gan par spyad pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gan par spyad pa ste /
translated: Because even those who practice wrongly,

original: sgrub pa'i spyod pa ma tshang ba rnams kyang 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i spyod pa ma tshang ba rnams kyang 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: that is, those whose practice of the means is incomplete, are successful.

original: des na dngos grub mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽mkha' 'gro ma'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo @61a * //
analyzed: des na dngos grub mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro // mkha' 'gro ma'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo @61a * //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of the actualization of power, i.e., for the sake of the actualization of power.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the dakinis, he says, his own nature, etc.

original: rang gi ngo bo yongs su bsgyur na zhes pa ni rang gi gnas yongs su gyur pa'i sngon du bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yongs su bsgyur na zhes pa ni rang gi gnas yongs su gyur pa'i sngon du bya ba ste /
translated: His own nature is completely transformed, i.e., his own abode is transformed.

original: bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa ni dngos po'i gnas skabs su grub pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa ni dngos po'i gnas skabs su grub pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The supreme bliss, etc., is the complete perfection of the established state of being.

original: bud med kun gyi sgyu ma ni bud med thams cad kyi sbyor ba bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: bud med kun gyi sgyu ma ni bud med thams cad kyi sbyor ba bsgoms pas so //
translated: The illusion of all women is the practice of all women.

original: grub pa ni rdzogs par gyur pa 'di ni /
analyzed: grub pa ni rdzogs par gyur pa 'di ni /
translated: Accomplishment is the perfection of this.

original: ngo mtshar sgyu ma'i phyag rgya 'di //
analyzed: ngo mtshar sgyu ma'i phyag rgya 'di //
translated: This is the amazing illusory seal.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ngo mtshar sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ngo mtshar sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: The various wonders of the Blessed One.

original: bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The seal of supreme bliss and so forth is called the dakini. This is the remainder of the verse.

original: skad gang gis she na /
analyzed: skad gang gis she na /
translated: By what language?

original: brdar bstan to zhes pa ste /
analyzed: brdar bstan to zhes pa ste /
translated: It is taught by convention.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi brda'i tshig tu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi brda'i tshig tu'o //
translated: In the conventional language of all buddhas.

original: sgra'i nges pa'i tshig nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra'i nges pa'i tshig nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the very etymology of the term,

original: d'a ni nam mkhar 'gro ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: d'a ni nam mkhar 'gro ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, Dākinī is one who moves in the sky, and so forth.

original: d'a zhes bya ba'i yi ge'i khams las ni mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: d'a zhes bya ba'i yi ge'i khams las ni mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya'o //
translated: From the element of the syllable dā, it is called dakini.

original: de bas na ;🔽nam mkha' kun du spyod grub pas //
analyzed: de bas na ; nam mkha' kun du spyod grub pas //
translated: Therefore,🔽she is known as a dakini

original: mkha' 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags //
translated: because she moves everywhere in the sky.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rab tu grags par nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu grags par nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is well known as the universal.

original: thams cad du ma lus pa'i phyag rgya ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya yin la de yang thams cad du ma lus pa'i bde ba'i mchog yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du ma lus pa'i phyag rgya ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya yin la de yang thams cad du ma lus pa'i bde ba'i mchog yin te /
translated: The seal of all without exception is the seal of Vajrasattva, and that is the supreme bliss of all without exception.

original: nam mkha' kun du 'gro bas na mnyam par sbyor pas thams cad ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' kun du 'gro bas na mnyam par sbyor pas thams cad ni /
translated: Since it is the universal space, all is the union,

original: mkha' 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags so //
translated: and it is well known as the dakini.

original: de yang 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: And that is taught as follows:

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' thams cad du 'gro ba grub pa'i phyag rgya chen po ni nam mkha' kun du 'gro ba zhes bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' thams cad du 'gro ba grub pa'i phyag rgya chen po ni nam mkha' kun du 'gro ba zhes bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The seal of the universal accomplishment of the Blessed One, Vajrasattva, is the universal space, and that is the supreme bliss of all without exception.

original: sangs rgyas khams zhes pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i khams ni sangs rgyas kyi khams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas khams zhes pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i khams ni sangs rgyas kyi khams te /
translated: The buddha element is the element of the buddhas and so forth.

original: de ni mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: de ni mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: That is the meaning of the term dakini.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i yang khams kyi sgra 'di nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i yang khams kyi sgra 'di nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: The term element is also taught by this very term in the context of Vairochana and so forth and their retinue.

original: de bas na de rnams kyis kun du 'gro bar grub pa de ni /
analyzed: de bas na de rnams kyis kun du 'gro bar grub pa de ni /
translated: Therefore, the accomplishment of their omnipresence🔽is well known as the dakini

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid kyi //🔽mkha' 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags //🔽zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid kyi // mkha' 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags // zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: of the nature of all buddhas.🔽Here, one should understand that the firm-minded meditator, first of all, visualizes the wind mandala arising from the seed syllable and the syllable combined, and then, on that wind mandala, the vajra bird is fluttering.

original: 'dir yang sgom pa brtan pa'i blos dang po snying po dang spel ba'i yi ge de las byung ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje nam mkha' lding gis rnam par bskyod @61b bzhin pa'i rang gi lha'i bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bsgoms na
analyzed: 'dir yang sgom pa brtan pa'i blos dang po snying po dang spel ba'i yi ge de las byung ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje nam mkha' lding gis rnam par bskyod @61b bzhin pa'i rang gi lha'i bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bsgoms na
translated: Then, one should visualize oneself as one's deity just as it is.

original: / nam mkhar 'gyur ro zhes man ngag las bshad do //
analyzed: / nam mkhar 'gyur ro zhes man ngag las bshad do //
translated: Then, one should understand that one becomes space according to the esoteric instruction.

original: bshad ces bya ba ni rab tu grags so //
analyzed: bshad ces bya ba ni rab tu grags so //
translated: The term then means well known.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub las thob pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub las thob pa ste /
translated: The nature of all buddhas is the attainment of the spiritual power of Vajrasattva.

original: bde ba chen po zhes bshad pa yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes bshad pa yang de nyid yin no //
translated: That is also explained as great bliss.

original: sgyu ma thams cad rab sbyor ba //
analyzed: sgyu ma thams cad rab sbyor ba //
translated: The union of all illusions

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ma lus par sprul pa la rab tu 'jug pa las gang zhig skyes pa'i bde ba dam pa de ni bde ba'i mchog ces bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ma lus par sprul pa la rab tu 'jug pa las gang zhig skyes pa'i bde ba dam pa de ni bde ba'i mchog ces bshad pa ste /
translated: That which is the highest bliss born from engaging in the emanation of the entire mandala is explained as the supreme bliss.

original: de bas na de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro sgyu ma bde ba'i mchog ces bya bar grags so //
analyzed: de bas na de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro sgyu ma bde ba'i mchog ces bya bar grags so //
translated: Therefore, because of being of the nature of that, the Bhagavān is renowned as the supreme of all buddhas, the union of all buddhas, the supreme bliss of the magical dakini.

original: da ni sgyu ma thams cad kyi rab tu sbyor ba ma lus par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sgyu ma thams cad kyi rab tu sbyor ba ma lus par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach all the applications of all the magic[k],

original: kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “everywhere” and so forth.

original: yul kun du dang dngos po kun nas dang / dngos po thams cad kun du ste dus kun du dang rnam pa kun te /
analyzed: yul kun du dang dngos po kun nas dang / dngos po thams cad kun du ste dus kun du dang rnam pa kun te /
translated: Everywhere in the object, everywhere in the thing, and everywhere in all things, at all times, and in all ways,

original: rnam pa thams cad du bdag nyid kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bdag nyid kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: one should become just oneself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says “because of being the nature of all buddhas” and so forth.

original: de ltar 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan cing /
analyzed: de ltar 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan cing /
translated: Thus, this shows the Blessed One as the nature of all things,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sgom pa'i sbyor ba ston to //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sgom pa'i sbyor ba ston to //
translated: and teaches the application of meditation in equipoise.

original: de bas na dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to extensively teach that very nature of all things,

original: sangs rgyas brtan g-yo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas brtan g-yo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said the firm and moving Buddha... and so on.

original: sems ni kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pas na /
analyzed: sems ni kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pas na /
translated: Since the mind is the basis of all afflictions,

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the mind is the foundation consciousness.

original: de nyid stong pa nyid brtan par bsgoms pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las rnam par dben par gyur pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa ni sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid stong pa nyid brtan par bsgoms pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las rnam par dben par gyur pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa ni sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
translated: That very [mind], by firmly meditating on emptiness, becomes free from the duality of subject and object, and the form of a moon disc is called the being.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig tu sbyor ba ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig tu sbyor ba ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The application of the mind to the one-pointed observation of all phenomena as having the nature of non-existence is concentration.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par bsgoms pa ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par bsgoms pa ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin la /
translated: The meditation on the complete moon mandala is the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de nyid byang chub kyi don du spyod pa yin pas byang chub spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid byang chub kyi don du spyod pa yin pas byang chub spyod pa'o //
translated: Since that is the practice for the sake of enlightenment, it is the practice of enlightenment.

original: de'i steng du rdo rje bsgom pa'i nga rgyal bskyed la /
analyzed: de'i steng du rdo rje bsgom pa'i nga rgyal bskyed la /
translated: On top of that, one should generate the pride of meditating on the vajra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su zhugs pa las rang gi lha'i ngo bor bsgom pa nas /🔽ji @62a * //🔽srid mchod pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi lha'i sbyor ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su zhugs pa las rang gi lha'i ngo bor bsgom pa nas / ji @62a * // srid mchod pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi lha'i sbyor ba bshad pa ni /
translated: From the entry of the Tathagata, one meditates on the nature of one's deity,🔽up to the end of the offerings.

original: gdul bya'i sbyor bas rnam pa tha dad par gyur pa ni sna tshogs nyid do //
analyzed: gdul bya'i sbyor bas rnam pa tha dad par gyur pa ni sna tshogs nyid do //
translated: The explanation of the yoga of the deity is the diversity of different forms due to the yoga of the disciples.

original: gzhan dag na re byang chub kyi spyod pa ni rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa'i gzugs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re byang chub kyi spyod pa ni rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa'i gzugs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa yin la /
translated: Others say that the practice of enlightenment is the benefit of sentient beings by the form of the Victorious One and the form of the Honey Maker.

original: de kho na nyid ni rnam pa tha dad pas sna tshogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni rnam pa tha dad pas sna tshogs pa nyid de /
translated: Reality is diversity by way of different aspects.

original: snying stobs rdul dang mun gyis kyang /
analyzed: snying stobs rdul dang mun gyis kyang /
translated: By sattva, rajas, and tamas,

original: gang phyir sems can don 'gyur bas //
analyzed: gang phyir sems can don 'gyur bas //
translated: Since it is for the sake of sentient beings,

original: des na bdag ni kun bzang ste //
analyzed: des na bdag ni kun bzang ste //
translated: therefore I am Samantabhadra,

original: byang chub spyod pas ji bzhin 'gro //
analyzed: byang chub spyod pas ji bzhin 'gro //
translated: and I go forth as the conduct of enlightenment.

original: zhes gsungs pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that in this way, it is of various aspects,🔽it is said:

original: de bzhin bdud dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin bdud dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, Mara, and so on.

original: lam log par 'jug pa'i sems can sems gsod pas nyen pas na /
analyzed: lam log par 'jug pa'i sems can sems gsod pas nyen pas na /
translated: Since sentient beings who enter the wrong path are afflicted by the killing of the mind,

original: bdud de rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: bdud de rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: that Mara is Vajrasattva.

original: de nyid bdud bzhi las rgyal bar gyur pas na bdud las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bdud bzhi las rgyal bar gyur pas na bdud las rgyal ba'o //
translated: Since he has become victorious over the four Maras, he is the Victor over Mara.

original: rang gi sems so sor rtogs pa ni byang chub yin la de nyid sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rang gi sems so sor rtogs pa ni byang chub yin la de nyid sangs rgyas te /
translated: Enlightenment is the individual realization of one's own mind, and that itself is the Buddha,

original: rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Vairocana.

original: ye shes lnga yi bdag nyid can rtse lnga pa'i khro bo'i rdo rje ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga yi bdag nyid can rtse lnga pa'i khro bo'i rdo rje ni rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra is the wrathful five-pronged vajra, which is the nature of the five wisdoms.

original: rdo rje 'dzin par mdzad pas rdo rje 'dzin nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin par mdzad pas rdo rje 'dzin nyid do //
translated: Since he is the holder of the vajra, he is Vajradhara.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid ngo bo ni padma'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid ngo bo ni padma'o //
translated: The nature of the reality of natural purity, which has the nature of the discriminating wisdom, is the lotus.

original: padmo 'dzin par mdzad pas na padmo 'chang ste /
analyzed: padmo 'dzin par mdzad pas na padmo 'chang ste /
translated: Since he holds the lotus, he is the lotus-holder,

original: padmo gar gyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: padmo gar gyi dbang phyug go //
translated: the lord of the dance of the lotus.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid rin po che zur brgyad pa ni nor bu'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid rin po che zur brgyad pa ni nor bu'o //
translated: The nature of the wisdom of equality, the eight-faceted jewel, is the gem.

original: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje nyi ma'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje nyi ma'o //
translated: Since he holds that, he is the vajra sun.

original: rta mchog ni drag po'i tshul kun gyi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa yin pas na bshad do //
analyzed: rta mchog ni drag po'i tshul kun gyi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa yin pas na bshad do //
translated: Since the supreme horse abides in the nature of all fierce modes, it is explained.

original: de dag gi yang zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdud la sogs par bstan pa'i rigs ni 'khor yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi yang zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdud la sogs par bstan pa'i rigs ni 'khor yin no //
translated: And their retinue means that the family of Vajrasattva and so on, which is taught to be Mara and so on, is the retinue.

original: thugs rje'i bdag nyid can du gyur pas na 'dod chags so //
analyzed: thugs rje'i bdag nyid can du gyur pas na 'dod chags so //
translated: Since he has become the nature of compassion, he is passion.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi thar pa'i bdag nyid can du gyur bas 'dod chags dang bral bas na 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi thar pa'i bdag nyid can du gyur bas 'dod chags dang bral bas na 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: He is free from attachment, since he has become the nature of the liberation of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: dngos grub thams cad la rjes su dgyes pas na 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad la rjes su dgyes pas na 'dod pa'o //
translated: He is desire, since he delights in all powers.

original: dngos grub thams cad mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba can yin pas na grol ba ste /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba can yin pas na grol ba ste /
translated: He is liberation, since he is the bliss of the unchanging of all powers.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das 'dod pa dang thar pa ci lta bu lags /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das 'dod pa dang thar pa ci lta bu lags /
translated: Moreover, what is the desire and liberation of the Bhagavān?

original: 'dod chags chen po bcom ldan @62b 'das //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po bcom ldan @62b 'das //
translated: The Bhagavān is great desire,

original: dngos grub kun la rjes su dgyes //
analyzed: dngos grub kun la rjes su dgyes //
translated: he delights in all powers,

original: dngos grub thams cad mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad mi 'gyur ba //
translated: all powers are unchanging,

original: bde ba chen po shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: bde ba chen po shes par bya // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: he is known as great bliss.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na dus gsum mo //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na dus gsum mo //
translated: He is the three times, since he has the nature of the past, etc.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sring pa'i ngo bo nyid pas na srid gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sring pa'i ngo bo nyid pas na srid gsum mo //
translated: He is the three existences, since he has the nature of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: theg pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can pas na mchog gsum mo //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can pas na mchog gsum mo //
translated: He is the three vehicles, since he has the nature of the three vehicles.

original: rgyal bar byed pa la sogs pa spun gsum gyi ngo bo nyid pas na 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: rgyal bar byed pa la sogs pa spun gsum gyi ngo bo nyid pas na 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: The three worlds are so called because they are the nature of the three brothers, namely, the creator and so on.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams can pas na khams gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams can pas na khams gsum mo //
translated: The three realms are so called because they are the realms of desire and so on.

original: rnam pa tha dad pas rnam pa sna tshogs pas so ;
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pas rnam pa sna tshogs pas so ;
translated: They are various because they are of different kinds.

original: / ri la sogs pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: / ri la sogs pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Mountains and so on are abodes.

original: mi la sogs pa ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: mi la sogs pa ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: Humans and so on are life-forms.

original: kun du khyab pas na thams cad tu'o //
analyzed: kun du khyab pas na thams cad tu'o //
translated: Everywhere means all-pervasively.

original: mtha' yas mchog ni thog ma dang mtha' thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas mchog ni thog ma dang mtha' thug pa med pa'o //
translated: Infinite means without beginning or end.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam par ston pa nyid dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam par ston pa nyid dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: It is equal to the realm of phenomena, which is taught to be the same.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings dang 'dra ba ni mur thug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings dang 'dra ba ni mur thug pa med pa ste /
translated: Space is similar to the realm of phenomena in being infinite.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang nam mkha'i dbyings nges pa'i tshig gnyis smos pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa la grags pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang nam mkha'i dbyings nges pa'i tshig gnyis smos pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa la grags pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The two terms, realm of phenomena and realm of space, should be seen as being known respectively in the supramundane and mundane worlds.

original: dngos po thams cad ni chos thams cad de /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni chos thams cad de /
translated: All things are all phenomena.

original: de dag gis ni rang byung nyid du gyur par ston to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rang byung nyid du gyur par ston to //
translated: They show that he is self-arisen.

original: nam mkha' kun gyi skabs na dpal //🔽zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' thams cad du go skabs yod pa'i dpal gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' kun gyi skabs na dpal // zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' thams cad du go skabs yod pa'i dpal gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The glorious one who is the space of all space.🔽The glorious one who is the space of all space is the one who has that.

original: nam mkha' thams cad kyi skabs can gyi dpal gang la yod pa zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' thams cad kyi skabs can gyi dpal gang la yod pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: He is the glorious one who is the space of all space.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: This shows that he is the Blessed One.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The Tathagata Vajrasattva.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni gcig pu rab tu che ba'i lha zhes bya ba ston to /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni gcig pu rab tu che ba'i lha zhes bya ba ston to /
translated: This shows that he is the one god who is supreme.

original: da ni thob par byed pa'i thabs kyi sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyag rgya bstan par bya ba'i phyir bskal ba bye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni thob par byed pa'i thabs kyi sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyag rgya bstan par bya ba'i phyir bskal ba bye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature of the application of the means of attainment, he says, in millions of eons, etc.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
translated: All buddhas are Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kun bdag gis ni bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun bdag gis ni bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis te /
translated: The one who is the nature of all buddhas, by means of the characteristics of supreme bliss, etc.

original: bde ba'i mchog ni bde ba'i dam pa rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog ni bde ba'i dam pa rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa'o //
translated: Supreme bliss is the highest bliss, together with its cause and result.

original: bdag nyid bsgrubs pa ni lha'i gzugs su rang yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid bsgrubs pa ni lha'i gzugs su rang yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Having accomplished oneself is having transformed oneself into the divine body.

original: shin tu ni phul du byung @63a * //
analyzed: shin tu ni phul du byung @63a * //
translated: Very is excellent.

original: bar ro // sangs rgyas kun bdag bde mchog go //
analyzed: bar ro // sangs rgyas kun bdag bde mchog go //
translated: The nature of all buddhas is supreme bliss.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bla na med pa'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba nyams su myong ba'o //🔽bdag nyid bsgoms pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bsam pa dang / dgos pa can ni yang dag pa'i sems dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bla na med pa'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba nyams su myong ba'o // bdag nyid bsgoms pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bsam pa dang / dgos pa can ni yang dag pa'i sems dang ldan pa ste /
translated: This means that one experiences the unsurpassed bliss and mental joy by means of the nature of Vajrasattva, etc.🔽Having the nature of meditation on oneself is the intention, and the purpose is having a correct mind.

original: yang dag pa'i sems kyis de kho na nyid la dmigs pa'i sems dang sbyor bar gyur pa ni yang dag pa'i sems la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sems kyis de kho na nyid la dmigs pa'i sems dang sbyor bar gyur pa ni yang dag pa'i sems la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Correct mind is the mind that focuses on reality.

original: gzhan dag gi rnal 'byor yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems de dang mi ldan pa des ni de'i gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi rnal 'byor yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems de dang mi ldan pa des ni de'i gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The other, who does not possess that unreal imagination of yoga, has an object that is the nature of a reflection,

original: gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo sa dmigs pa las skyes pa ni yang dag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo sa dmigs pa las skyes pa ni yang dag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: which is born from the apprehension of the essence of a reflection, but is not real.

original: de las bzlog pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the opposite of that?

original: yang dag mchog sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag mchog sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is stated: “the mind of perfect supreme self” and so on.

original: rang gi lha'i bdag nyid du bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid ni rang gi mchog go //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i bdag nyid du bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid ni rang gi mchog go //
translated: The self that is cultivated as having the nature of one’s deity is one’s supreme self.

original: rang gi sems kyi mtshan nyid du sbyor ba ni bdag sbyor ba ste /🔽sems can rnams kyi sems gang yin //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi mtshan nyid du sbyor ba ni bdag sbyor ba ste / sems can rnams kyi sems gang yin //
translated: The application to the characteristic of one’s mind is one’s application.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is stated: “The mind of sentient beings” and so on.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni rnam par mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni rnam par mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Unchanging is unmoving.

original: gzugs brnyan ni gzugs su byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni gzugs su byas pa'o //
translated: A reflection is a form that is made.

original: lugs ma ni sku gdung gis yongs su bkang ste byas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lugs ma ni sku gdung gis yongs su bkang ste byas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: A statue is one that is made by filling a mold with relics and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ri mor bris pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ri mor bris pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term “and so on” includes paintings and so on.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar byang chub sems la rab tu brtson pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar byang chub sems la rab tu brtson pa ste /
translated: For the following reason, the one who is devoted to the Thought of Enlightenment,

original: byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa'i rim gyis rnal 'byor ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa'i rim gyis rnal 'byor ba ste /
translated: the yogi/nī, by the process of cultivating the Thought of Enlightenment,

original: sngags pa rgyu des na bdag nyid lhar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sngags pa rgyu des na bdag nyid lhar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: by that cause, the mantrin becomes a deity.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa nyid du bsgoms pa'i rim gyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i bdag nyid 'di ci skad du sngar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa nyid du bsgoms pa'i rim gyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i bdag nyid 'di ci skad du sngar bshad pa yin no //
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is the process of cultivating emptiness, the nature of the complete moon-disk, as previously explained.

original: rdo rje ni der rang gi mtshan mar bstan pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje ni der rang gi mtshan mar bstan pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The vajra is the nature of the sign of that [moon-disk].

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi ni ji ltar bdag nyid kyi lha'i gzugs su gyur ba'i bdag rang gi yin gyis phyi rol gyi lugs ma la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi ni ji ltar bdag nyid kyi lha'i gzugs su gyur ba'i bdag rang gi yin gyis phyi rol gyi lugs ma la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: All the Buddhas are the nature of one’s own deity-form, not of external images, etc.

original: de lta bas na tshul 'di ltar rang gi dam tshig la sbyor ba ni thams cad du bdag sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshul 'di ltar rang gi dam tshig la sbyor ba ni thams cad du bdag sbyor ba ste /
translated: Therefore, in this way, one is devoted to one’s own commitment, devoted to oneself in all ways.

original: ye shes sems dpa' dang gnyis su med pa'i ngo bos sangs rgyas thams cad thob ste bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis ji ltar rnal 'byor ba rang nyid lha'i go 'phang mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' dang gnyis su med pa'i ngo bos sangs rgyas thams cad thob ste bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis ji ltar rnal 'byor ba rang nyid lha'i go 'phang mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: By the essence of non-duality with the wisdom-being, one attains all the Buddhas, and by the power of meditation, one actualizes the state of the deity just as the yogin himself.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni rang @63b gi sems so //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni rang @63b gi sems so //
translated: The word self refers to one's own mind.

original: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word itself is for emphasis.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: All Buddhas refers to all Tathagatas.

original: dpa' bo thams cad ni mdo sde'i tshul las nges par skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
analyzed: dpa' bo thams cad ni mdo sde'i tshul las nges par skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
translated: All heroes refers to the Bodhisattvas born from the Sutra system.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad ni sngags kyi tshul las mngon par grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad ni sngags kyi tshul las mngon par grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: All Vajra-holders refers to the Bodhisattvas who have accomplished the Mantra system.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis tshe 'di nyid la 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis tshe 'di nyid la 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: By the power of meditation, one attains them in this very life.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdud par byed pa'i rang bzo yongs su dgag pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdud par byed pa'i rang bzo yongs su dgag pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One... and so forth is for the purpose of refuting the fabrication of the compiler.

original: de kho na nyid dam pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam pa lnga ste de nyid snang ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid dam pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam pa lnga ste de nyid snang ba'o //
translated: That reality is the five aspects of the gnosis of omniscience, and that is the appearance.

original: de kho na nyid ni yul te de la 'jug pa ni ji ltar ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi rang gi lha'i phyag rgya gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni yul te de la 'jug pa ni ji ltar ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi rang gi lha'i phyag rgya gang yin pa ste /
translated: Reality is the object, and the engagement with that is the nature of the gnosis, which is the mudra of one’s own deity.

original: de ni de kho na nyid snang ba dam pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de kho na nyid snang ba dam pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the mudra of the gnosis that engages with the object of the sublime appearance of reality.

original: de gzhung gang gis brtag pa de la ni de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gzhung gang gis brtag pa de la ni de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what is being referred to by the term “investigation” in the root text.

original: brtag pa dang po'i 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: brtag pa dang po'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary to the first chapter.

original: // / de ltar mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i sgo nas rdo rje sems dpa' sbyor ba'i rang gi ngo bor bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: // / de ltar mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i sgo nas rdo rje sems dpa' sbyor ba'i rang gi ngo bor bshad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the nature of the union with Vajrasattva is explained through the five manifest enlightenments.

original: ye shes tsam gyis snyoms par 'jug //
analyzed: ye shes tsam gyis snyoms par 'jug //
translated: The union is said to be merely gnosis.

original: sbyor ba zhes byar zhes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes byar zhes par bya // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: The union is said to be the union.

original: der rnal 'byor pa nges pa dang ldan pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: der rnal 'byor pa nges pa dang ldan pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to guide the yogis who are certain there,

original: ye shes sems dpa' nang du bstim pa sngon du song bas /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' nang du bstim pa sngon du song bas /
translated: Having previously dissolved the gnosis-being into oneself,

original: bcom ldan 'das rjes su sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzhugs par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽'di ni rnal 'byor bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rjes su sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzhugs par bstan par bya ba'i phyir / 'di ni rnal 'byor bcom ldan 'das //
translated: in order to demonstrate the Bhagavān’s abiding in the nature of union,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “This yoga is the Bhagavān,” and so forth.

original: 'di ni zhes pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i rnal 'byor gyi bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i rnal 'byor gyi bdag nyid can te /
translated: “ This” refers to the nature of the yoga that was just explained.

original: rdo rje sems dpar bdag sbyor bas //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpar bdag sbyor bas //
translated: “ I am united with Vajrasattva”

original: rab tu 'grub po zhes bya bar ro //🔽rdo rje sems dpar bdag sbyor ba //
analyzed: rab tu 'grub po zhes bya bar ro // rdo rje sems dpar bdag sbyor ba //
translated: means “I am well-established.”

original: zhes bya ba ni mdun na bzhugs pa de dang gnyis su med par gyur nas bdag nyid thams cad du lha'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs su snang bas thams cad 'bebs pa'o //🔽sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdun na bzhugs pa de dang gnyis su med par gyur nas bdag nyid thams cad du lha'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs su snang bas thams cad 'bebs pa'o // sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: “ I am united with Vajrasattva” means that, having become non-dual with that [Vajrasattva] who is present in front, all of oneself appears as the body, speech, and mind of the deity, and all is absorbed.

original: zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “union of all buddhas” has been explained.

original: rnal 'byor ni de la bsgom pa goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni de la bsgom pa goms par byed pa'o //
translated: “ Yoga” is the cultivation of meditation on that.

original: de'i dbang phyug ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba la dbang thob pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang phyug ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba la dbang thob pa ste /
translated: His lordship is the attainment of mastery over the freedom from all obscurations.

original: thams cad las mchog tu gyur pa'i dbang phyug chen po'i @64a * //
analyzed: thams cad las mchog tu gyur pa'i dbang phyug chen po'i @64a * //
translated: Up to the great lord, who is supreme over all.

original: bar du'o // de las gang bla na med pa'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: bar du'o // de las gang bla na med pa'i bde ba ste /
translated: From that, there is the unsurpassed bliss.

original: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi bde ba chen po yin la de yang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi bde ba chen po yin la de yang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: That is the great bliss of the lord of yoga, who is united with all the buddhas, and that is also fully accomplished. Thus, cause and effect are presented.

original: de nyid rgyur bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rgyur bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that as the cause,

original: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therefore, etc.”

original: de bas zhes pa ni rjes su sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bas zhes pa ni rjes su sbyor ba'o //
translated: “ Therefore” is a conjunction.

original: sangs rgyas bde ba kun zhes pa ni lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bde ba kun zhes pa ni lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: “ The bliss of the buddhas, all” is the nature of all the deities.

original: bde ba de ni bde ba nyid kyis 'thob bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba de ni bde ba nyid kyis 'thob bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That bliss is attained by bliss itself.

original: bde ba de nyid rjes su bstan par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba de nyid rjes su bstan par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach that very bliss, [the Bhagavān] declares, “all buddhas,” and so on.

original: bde ba nyid kyis zhes gang gsungs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba nyid kyis zhes gang gsungs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach what was declared as “by bliss itself,”

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “here,” and so on.

original: de la ni rjes su sbyor ba la'o //
analyzed: de la ni rjes su sbyor ba la'o //
translated: There, [means] in the application.

original: khrus ni gtsang sbra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khrus ni gtsang sbra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Purification is cleanliness, and so on.

original: de mi dgos pas ci ltar 'dod pa bzhin spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de mi dgos pas ci ltar 'dod pa bzhin spyod pa'o //
translated: Since that is unnecessary, [one should] act as one desires.

original: bsdam pa ni lan tshva la sogs pa yongs su spong pa ste /
analyzed: bsdam pa ni lan tshva la sogs pa yongs su spong pa ste /
translated: Restraint is the avoidance of salt, and so on.

original: de mi dgos pas thams cad bza' ba'o //
analyzed: de mi dgos pas thams cad bza' ba'o //
translated: Since that is unnecessary, [one should] eat everything.

original: dka' thub ni yul thams cad las ldog pa ste /
analyzed: dka' thub ni yul thams cad las ldog pa ste /
translated: Austerity is turning away from all objects.

original: de mi dgos pas na thams cad spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de mi dgos pas na thams cad spyod pa'o //
translated: Since that is unnecessary, [one should] enjoy everything.

original: dka' ba spyod pa ni rig pa'i brtul zhugs te /
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa ni rig pa'i brtul zhugs te /
translated: The practice is the observance of knowledge.

original: de mi dgos pas 'dod pa'i dga' ba la ci dgar spyod pa'o ;
analyzed: de mi dgos pas 'dod pa'i dga' ba la ci dgar spyod pa'o ;
translated: Since that is unnecessary, one should enjoy the pleasures of desire as one wishes.

original: / spyod pa ci dgar 'dod pa byed //
analyzed: / spyod pa ci dgar 'dod pa byed //
translated: One should act as one desires.

original: ces pa ni ci dgar 'dug cing nyal ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni ci dgar 'dug cing nyal ba'o //
translated: This is lying down and sleeping as one desires.

original: de ltar rjes su sbyor ba'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan nas rjes su sbyor ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su sbyor ba'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan nas rjes su sbyor ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the greatness of the subsequent yoga, in order to teach that subsequent yoga,

original: bskal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bskal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “in an instant, etc.”

original: sangs rgyas dam pa thams cad ni rang gi ngo bo ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dam pa thams cad ni rang gi ngo bo ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: “All the excellent buddhas” are the nature of the deity just as it is.

original: phyag rgya'i cho ga zhes pa ni lha'i skur mdun du gzhag pas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i cho ga zhes pa ni lha'i skur mdun du gzhag pas so //
translated: “The procedure of the seal” is the deity’s form placed in front.

original: bsgrubs nas zhes pa ni 'dir nang du bstim pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrubs nas zhes pa ni 'dir nang du bstim pa'o //
translated: “Having accomplished” means having dissolved it into oneself.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid can gyi phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs su'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid can gyi phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs su'o //
translated: “One’s own” means the form of the great seal endowed with the previously explained yoga.

original: sgrub pa ni rjes su sbyor ba'i bar du byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rjes su sbyor ba'i bar du byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: “Accomplishment” is the consecration up to the subsequent yoga.

original: brtag par bya zhes pa ni sngar bshad par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya zhes pa ni sngar bshad par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: “One should imagine” means “one should explain as before.”

original: byin gyis brlabs pa de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽sangs rgyas thams cad byin gyis rlob //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir / sangs rgyas thams cad byin gyis rlob //
translated: In order to clarify that consecration,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “all the buddhas consecrate.”

original: de nas yang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas sangs rgyas thams cad rab tu 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas sangs rgyas thams cad rab tu 'grub pa'o //
translated: Then, by the transmission from one to another, all the buddhas are accomplished.

original: ldan pa zhes pa ni de nyid @64b de dang lhan cig tu gnyis su med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes pa ni de nyid @64b de dang lhan cig tu gnyis su med par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Endowed” means that [the yogin] becomes nondual with that.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i sbyor ba ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i sbyor ba ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: “All the buddhas” means just as one’s deity is engaged.

original: bden pa dag kyang mthong zhes pa ni dam tshig thob pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa dag kyang mthong zhes pa ni dam tshig thob pa'o //
translated: “And sees the truths” means attaining the commitments.

original: rnal 'byor thams cad mnyam par sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni 'khor gyi gzugs kyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor thams cad mnyam par sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni 'khor gyi gzugs kyis gnas pa'o //
translated: “By the union of all yogas” means abiding in the form of the retinue.

original: 'di dang sangs rgyas thams cad la ni rjes su sbyor ba byas pa'i sngags 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di dang sangs rgyas thams cad la ni rjes su sbyor ba byas pa'i sngags 'di'o //
translated: This and all the buddhas are the mantra of the one who has performed the subsequent yoga.

original: bud med dag kyang zhes pa la kyang gi sgra ni skyes pa'ang grol bar 'gyur bya ste /
analyzed: bud med dag kyang zhes pa la kyang gi sgra ni skyes pa'ang grol bar 'gyur bya ste /
translated: “And women” — the word “and” indicates that men are also liberated.

original: skyes pa'i gzugs spongs nas lha mo'i ngo bor yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i gzugs spongs nas lha mo'i ngo bor yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned the form of a man, they become the essence of a goddess.

original: de yis zhes pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rjes su sbyor ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: de yis zhes pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rjes su sbyor ba byas pa'o //
translated: “By that” means by the subsequent yoga as explained.

original: 'di ni zhes pa ni sngags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa ni sngags pa'o //
translated: This is the mantrin.

original: bdag nyid kun gnas pas ni zhes pa ni phyogs thams cad na gnas pa'o //🔽mchod pa thams cad ni phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor ba'i sna tshogs kyi yo byad kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kun gnas pas ni zhes pa ni phyogs thams cad na gnas pa'o // mchod pa thams cad ni phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor ba'i sna tshogs kyi yo byad kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: By dwelling in all is meant dwelling in all directions.

original: de nyid kyi sprin chen po la sogs pa grangs mang pos khyab pa ste des mchod pa'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis mchod pa byas pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi sprin chen po la sogs pa grangs mang pos khyab pa ste des mchod pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis mchod pa byas pa ni /
translated: All offerings are the nature of the various articles of the outer mandala, and by that is the great cloud, etc., which pervades with its multitude of enumerations.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa ste /🔽dpal rdo rje sems dpa' nyid dam /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa ste / dpal rdo rje sems dpa' nyid dam /
translated: By worshipping all the Tathagatas is meant that one is worthy of worship by all.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi lha nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi lha nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: By the state of glorious Vajrasattva is meant that one attains the state of all the deities just as they are.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ces pa ni thams cad kyis yongs su bskor ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid yongs su bsgom pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ces pa ni thams cad kyis yongs su bskor ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid yongs su bsgom pa yin la /
translated: By all is meant that one visualizes the nature of all things as being surrounded by all.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pas na /
translated: By that is meant that one is of the nature of that.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ni rnal 'byor thams cad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ni rnal 'byor thams cad do //
translated: The Blessed One is Vajrasattva, all yoga.

original: de'i nye bar sbyor ba ni de'i nga rgyal gyis nye bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de'i nye bar sbyor ba ni de'i nga rgyal gyis nye bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: His application is the application by his pride.

original: des dpal ni gzhir gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: des dpal ni gzhir gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: By that, one becomes glorious, the basis.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sku tshe dang lang tsho dang nad med pa dang bde ba dam pa'o //🔽rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi nye bar sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sku tshe dang lang tsho dang nad med pa dang bde ba dam pa'o // rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi nye bar sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The body of Vajrasattva is life, youth, health, and supreme bliss.

original: rnal 'byor kun ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽khams gsum zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor kun ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / khams gsum zhes pa ni /
translated: In order to teach the application of all yoga, [the Bhagavān] declares, “all yoga,” and so forth.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul te /
translated: The three realms are the objects of form and so forth.🔽They are the enjoyment of all yoga, taught and experienced.

original: de rnams rnal 'byor kun gyi longs spyod kyis bstan cing nyams su myong bzhin du bdag nyid kyi rang gi lha'i sku'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa la mchod do //
analyzed: de rnams rnal 'byor kun gyi longs spyod kyis bstan cing nyams su myong bzhin du bdag nyid kyi rang gi lha'i sku'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa la mchod do //
translated: While possessing the pride of one’s own deity’s body, one makes offerings to oneself.

original: bstan pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad do /
analyzed: bstan pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad do /
translated: Not only is it taught,

original: rnal 'byor kun gyi bde ba dag //
analyzed: rnal 'byor kun gyi bde ba dag //
translated: “all the bliss of all yoga

analyzed: bdag nyid kun du myong byed na //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is experienced by oneself.”

original: rang nyid sngar bshad pa'i rjes su @65a * //
analyzed: rang nyid sngar bshad pa'i rjes su @65a * //
translated: As explained above, you should🔽

original: sbyor bas mchod cing /
analyzed: sbyor bas mchod cing /
translated: One should worship with the previously explained application,

original: lhag par sbyor bas 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par sbyor bas 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and with the special application, one will attain accomplishment.

original: shin tu zhes pa ni bde ba'i rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu zhes pa ni bde ba'i rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: The word very means the highest joy.

original: lha mo thams cad dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can lhag pa'i sbyor ba'i bar yang 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lha mo thams cad dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can lhag pa'i sbyor ba'i bar yang 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One will also attain the special application, which has the characteristic of being in union with all goddesses.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid ni rang gi lha'i ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid ni rang gi lha'i ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The nature of all buddhas is one's own deity's nature just as it is.

original: des mchod pas bcud kyis len pa bzhin du bde ba'o //
analyzed: des mchod pas bcud kyis len pa bzhin du bde ba'o //
translated: By worshipping with that, there is bliss like an elixir.

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid ras ya ni bde ba des rdo rje sems dpar yang dag par sbyor ba ni ye shes sems dpar yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The nature of all buddhas is the bliss of the hero. By that bliss, the union with Vajrasattva is the union with the gnosis being.

analyzed: de rtogs par byed pas na dpal rdo rje sems dpar kun du sbyor ba'i brtag pa'o //

analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /

analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' sbyor ba'i mthu nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shin tu sbyor ba bstan te /

analyzed: de'i mthu ni brtan par byas pa'o //

original: des na bde ba chen po ste //
analyzed: des na bde ba chen po ste //
translated: Therefore, it is great bliss.

analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'di ltar bud med kyi rol pa'i nang du zhugs pas mchog 'dod pa'o //

analyzed: phul du byung ba'i rjes su chags pas lha mo thams cad la yid chags pas 'dod chags te /

analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad kyis rnal 'byor pa grub pa'o //
