analyzed: dkyil 'khor gang dang gang zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang gang ngo //
translated: “Any mandala” is any mandala of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: bsten pa zhes pa ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bsten pa zhes pa ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: “One should rely” is one should meditate.

original: de dang der zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de dang der zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: “In that and that” is the mandala.

original: mchod pa byas nas zhes pa ni mchod pa'o ;
analyzed: mchod pa byas nas zhes pa ni mchod pa'o ;
translated: “Having made offerings” is the offering.

original: / de las gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu sgo so so'i gtam ston pa'o //
analyzed: / de las gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu sgo so so'i gtam ston pa'o //
translated: “And also other than that” is the teaching of the individual door-tales after that.

original: rtog pa kun gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtog pa kun gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “All the imaginings” is

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'o //🔽ci rigs par ni sprul byas pa'i //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'o // ci rigs par ni sprul byas pa'i //
translated: The encouragement of Vajrasattva, etc.🔽Having created emanations as appropriate

original: zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par rol pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par rol pa'o //
translated: means having created emanations in whatever way is appropriate.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: ci ltar rang gi tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor du rang gi lhar sbyor ba'i slob ma dang lhan cig tu rang gi phyag mtshan dang / phyag rgyar ldan pas ji ltar bdag nyid dbugs dbyung bar smras pa bzhin du slob ma rnams la yang smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: ci ltar rang gi tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor du rang gi lhar sbyor ba'i slob ma dang lhan cig tu rang gi phyag mtshan dang / phyag rgyar ldan pas ji ltar bdag nyid dbugs dbyung bar smras pa bzhin du slob ma rnams la yang smra bar bya ste /
translated: Just as in one's own assembly mandala, together with the disciple who is conjoined with one's own deity, one should speak to the disciples, just as one has said one's own encouragement, endowed with one's own hand implement and seal.

original: de rnams kyis rang gi lha'i sbyor bas rang gi mngon par dad pa phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir smra ba bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis rang gi lha'i sbyor bas rang gi mngon par dad pa phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir smra ba bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Just as they should accomplish it, speaking in accordance with the perfection of their own faith, through the yoga of their own deity.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to sentient beings who engage in desire,🔽in order to demonstrate the encouragement of Bhagavān Vajrasattva,

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' dbugs dbyung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' dbugs dbyung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says:

original: sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning with “the hero” and so on.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhugs pas na /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhugs pas na /
translated: Since he abides in non-abiding nirvana,

original: da ltar byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba bzhin no //
translated: he is like the present.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid pas na 'da' bar dka' ba ste /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid pas na 'da' bar dka' ba ste /
translated: Since he has an unchanging nature, he is difficult to transcend,

original: chos kyi sku la bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la bya bar dgongs so //
translated: and he is intended to be the dharmakāya.

original: 'dul ba'i phyir zhes pa ni de rnams kyis sems can rnams 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i phyir zhes pa ni de rnams kyis sems can rnams 'dul ba'o //
translated: “In order to tame” means that they tame sentient beings.

original: byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what is done,

original: bya ba ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: the activity is in the relative.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dbugs dbyung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpas dbugs dbyung ba ste /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dbugs dbyung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpas dbugs dbyung ba ste /
translated: The encouragement of glorious Vajrasattva is the encouragement of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: 'dis 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams dbugs dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams dbugs dbyung ba'o //
translated: This is the encouragement of sentient beings who engage in desire and so on.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i bdag nyid can nyid kun rdzob tu 'dod @69a * //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i bdag nyid can nyid kun rdzob tu 'dod @69a * //
translated: Thus, the nature of the body of the nature of phenomena is asserted in the relative.

original: chags la spyod pa gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chags la spyod pa gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to tame those to be tamed who engage in desire,

original: bcom ldan 'das dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan nas /
translated: the Bhagavān, having demonstrated the nature of all things,

original: zhi ba la spyod pa'i sems can rnam gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi ba la spyod pa'i sems can rnam gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to tame the sentient beings who engage in peace,

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la bzhugs pas thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshul bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la bzhugs pas thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshul bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the mode of the nature of all, by abiding in the pure sphere of reality,

original: 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, “In the past, etc.”

original: stong pa nyid la shin tu brtson pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la shin tu brtson pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Exertion in emptiness” is having exertion in the nirvāṇa with remainder and without remainder.

original: 'gog pa'i chos nyid la sbyor bas //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos nyid la sbyor bas //
translated: “Connected to the reality of cessation”

original: zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: is connected to the two nirvāṇas as they have been explained.

original: 'gags shing zhes pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'gags shing zhes pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “Ceased” is with remainder.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: “Completely passed into nirvāṇa” is without remainder.

original: grol ba thams cad ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: grol ba thams cad ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: “All liberations” are the nirvāṇas of the śrāvakas and so on.

original: de'i rnam par byang ba ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos khong du chud nas thugs rje chen po bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par byang ba ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos khong du chud nas thugs rje chen po bskyed pa'o //
translated: Its purification is the realization of the nondual nature of things, and the generation of great compassion.

original: bskyed ces bya ba ni byas pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed ces bya ba ni byas pa'o //
translated: The word generation means creation.

original: stong pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni bden pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni bden pa ste /
translated: Not empty means true.

original: yongs su brtags pa las byung ba de yod pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa las byung ba de yod pa'o //
translated: That which is arisen from conceptualization exists.

original: mi stong min zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtags pa nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mi stong min zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtags pa nyid med pa'o //
translated: Not non-empty means that conceptualization itself does not exist.

original: dbu ma ni de gnyi ga med par 'dzin pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: dbu ma ni de gnyi ga med par 'dzin pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The middle is the wisdom that apprehends the absence of both.

original: dbu ma rab tu bsgrub pa'i bar de yang rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul yin pas na mi dmigs te /
analyzed: dbu ma rab tu bsgrub pa'i bar de yang rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul yin pas na mi dmigs te /
translated: Since that establishment of the middle is also the domain of conceptual thought, it is not perceived.

original: de nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba zhes brjod do //🔽snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung bas snying rje'i bdag nyid 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba zhes brjod do // snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung bas snying rje'i bdag nyid 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir /
translated: That itself is called the application of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi thabs yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi thabs yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Since it is embraced by great compassion, it is the method of the buddhas for the benefit of beings, who are of the nature of compassion.🔽The rest is as before.

original: de ni zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: That is Vajrasattva.

original: chos kyi tshig rnam par snang mdzad du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig rnam par snang mdzad du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word dharma is Vairochana.

original: rnam par 'phrul ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par 'phrul ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the emanation,

original: snying rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: snying rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he declares compassion, etc.

original: gang la snying rje nyid dang thabs yod cing shes rab kyi pha rul tu phyin pa ni dri ma med pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la snying rje nyid dang thabs yod cing shes rab kyi pha rul tu phyin pa ni dri ma med pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is so called because he has compassion, the means, and the stainless perfection of wisdom.

original: rtog pa med pa'i chos rnams la //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i chos rnams la //
translated: With regard to the non-conceptual dharmas,

original: zhes bya ba ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral yang gdul bya'i dbang gis dkyil 'khor dang phyag rgya la sogs pa thams cad du rtog cing yongs su gyur @69b pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral yang gdul bya'i dbang gis dkyil 'khor dang phyag rgya la sogs pa thams cad du rtog cing yongs su gyur @69b pa'o ;
translated: he is conceptual, i.e., he is transformed into all mandalas, seals, etc., in accordance with the disciples, even though he is free from all conceptualization.

original: / rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: / rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The non-conceptual is the non-dual nature.

original: sems can gyi don la rtog par byed pa'i kun rdzob po //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la rtog par byed pa'i kun rdzob po //
translated: The conventional is the conceptualization of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: don dam par ni brag ca'i sgra dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni brag ca'i sgra dang 'dra ste /
translated: Ultimately, he is like an echo.

original: sgra brnyan dang mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgra brnyan dang mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: It is like an echo.

original: chos ni dam tshig gsum mo //
analyzed: chos ni dam tshig gsum mo //
translated: The Dharma is the three commitments.

original: de ston pa'i tshig gang yin pa de ni chos kyi tshig go //
analyzed: de ston pa'i tshig gang yin pa de ni chos kyi tshig go //
translated: The words that teach that are the words of the Dharma.

original: de las bya ba ni chos kyi tshig tu gyur pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de las bya ba ni chos kyi tshig tu gyur pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: The action that arises from that is the action of the words of the Dharma.

original: theg pa chen po ni dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs kun dang las chen po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs kun dang las chen po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Great Vehicle is endowed with the great deeds of all the means, which are the great objective, practice, intuition, effort, and skill in means.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyi ngo bo nyid do //🔽tshe 'di nyid la sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i nges par bskyed pas che ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyi ngo bo nyid do // tshe 'di nyid la sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i nges par bskyed pas che ba'i phyir /
translated: It is the essence of the bodhisattva path with its result, and of the scriptures such as the Transcendent Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines.

original: theg pa chen po'i chen po ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chen po ste /
translated: It is the Great Vehicle of the Great Vehicle because it generates the certainty of Buddhahood, etc. in this very life.

original: rdo rje'i theg pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i theg pa'o //
translated: It is the Vajra Vehicle.

original: de las gang yang dag par byung ba'i yon tan rgyas pa ni sku gsum gyis bsdus pa ston te /
analyzed: de las gang yang dag par byung ba'i yon tan rgyas pa ni sku gsum gyis bsdus pa ston te /
translated: The expansion of the qualities that arise from that is the teaching of the three bodies.

original: mnyam med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse begins with “unequalled. ”

original: glu ni bstod pa'o //
analyzed: glu ni bstod pa'o //
translated: The song is the praise.

original: dus gsum pa ni dus rnams pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dus gsum pa ni dus rnams pa gsum mo //
translated: The three times are the three times.

original: dam tshig gsum ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dam tshig gsum ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The three commitments are the nature of the three bodies.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: mnyam med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mnyam med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “unequalled,” etc.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos kyi sku ston to //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos kyi sku ston to //
translated: By “unmoving,” he shows the Dharma Body.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Equality is thusness.

original: de nyid mchog gi chos so //
analyzed: de nyid mchog gi chos so //
translated: That itself is the supreme Dharma.

original: mnyam pa nyid de gang la yod pa de ni mnyam pa nyid mchog gi chos nyid can te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de gang la yod pa de ni mnyam pa nyid mchog gi chos nyid can te /
translated: He who has that equality has the nature of the supreme equality Dharma.

original: 'di nyid kyis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston to //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston to //
translated: By this he shows the Enjoyment Body.

original: thugs rje'i bdag nyid 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal sel zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bdag nyid 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal sel zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: “The nature of compassion, removing the suffering of the world,”

original: sprul ba'i sku'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don mdzad pa ston te /
analyzed: sprul ba'i sku'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don mdzad pa ston te /
translated: by this he shows the performance of the benefit of others by means of the Emanation Body.

original: de dag gsum par yang mnyam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gsum par yang mnyam pa med pa'o //
translated: Those three are also unequalled.

original: sdug bsngal sel ba ni snang ba dang / mi snang ba sdug bsngal rnams 'jig par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sel ba ni snang ba dang / mi snang ba sdug bsngal rnams 'jig par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Removing suffering is the destruction of the visible and invisible sufferings.

original: yon tan mtha' yas pa ni mthar thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas pa ni mthar thug pa med pa'o //
translated: Infinite qualities means that they are limitless.

original: dngos grub thams cad sbyin par mdzad pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thams cad stsol ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad sbyin par mdzad pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thams cad stsol ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The bestower of all powers means that he is the one who has the nature of bestowing all mundane and supramundane powers.

original: ci'i phyir de sdug bsngal rnams sel zhing yon tan gyi dngos grub stsol bar mdzad cen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de sdug bsngal rnams sel zhing yon tan gyi dngos grub stsol bar mdzad cen /
translated: Why does he remove suffering and bestow the power of qualities?

original: thugs rje'i bdag nyid ces gsungs pa'i @70a * //
analyzed: thugs rje'i bdag nyid ces gsungs pa'i @70a * //
translated: Because he is the embodiment of compassion.

original: phyir ro ; / gal te thugs rje'i bdag nyid can yin yang gang gis 'di ltar spyod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyir ro ; / gal te thugs rje'i bdag nyid can yin yang gang gis 'di ltar spyod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if he is the embodiment of compassion, what is his conduct like?

original: dri med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dri med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He is said to be stainless, etc.

original: sgrib pa thams cad dang bral bas dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad dang bral bas dri ma med pa'o //
translated: He is stainless because he is free from all obscurations.

original: mu stegs chan gzhan rnams kyis mi bskyod pas na mi g-yo ba'o ;
analyzed: mu stegs chan gzhan rnams kyis mi bskyod pas na mi g-yo ba'o ;
translated: He is unshakable because he cannot be shaken by other tīrthikas.

original: / rim gyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / thun mong ma yin pas mnyam pa med pa'i mchog gi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / rim gyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / thun mong ma yin pas mnyam pa med pa'i mchog gi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: gradually, the powers, fearlessnesses, etc. which are unequaled and supreme, not shared in common with the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Bodhisattvas.

original: de gang dag la yod pa de ni dam pa'i mchog chos can no //
analyzed: de gang dag la yod pa de ni dam pa'i mchog chos can no //
translated: He who has those is the one who has the supreme, holy Dharma.🔽In order to clarify what was said about being unequaled, he says,

original: mnyam pa med pa zhes gang gsungs pa de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa zhes gang gsungs pa de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: qualities and so on.

original: gang gis mi mnyam zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis mi mnyam zhe na /
translated: By what is he unequaled?

original: yon tan shin tu phra ba ste /
analyzed: yon tan shin tu phra ba ste /
translated: By the qualities which are extremely subtle,

original: rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'i dbye ba phye ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'i dbye ba phye ba'i yon tan no //
translated: which are divided into the best, middling, and lowest.

original: tshad med pa ni mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni mtha' med pa'o //
translated: Immeasurable means infinite.

original: gang dang mi mnyam zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang mi mnyam zhe na /
translated: By what is he unequaled?

original: dpe ni nam mkha' zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dpe ni nam mkha' zhes pa ste /
translated: The example is space.

original: gang gi phyir dper bya ba ni nam mkha' ltar tshad med pa dang yang bskrun du yod pa ma yin na dpe dman pas blta mos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dper bya ba ni nam mkha' ltar tshad med pa dang yang bskrun du yod pa ma yin na dpe dman pas blta mos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Since the example is immeasurable like space, and cannot be surpassed, what need is there to mention a lesser example?

original: yon tan med pa de rnams ni sems can khams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yon tan med pa de rnams ni sems can khams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Those who are devoid of good qualities, etc.

original: sems can gyi khams rnams la sangs rgyas kyi dngos grub mchog nges par stsal ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams rnams la sangs rgyas kyi dngos grub mchog nges par stsal ba'o //
translated: They definitely bestow the supreme spiritual power of buddhahood upon the realms of sentient beings.

original: de dag nyid gang gis byung zhe na /
analyzed: de dag nyid gang gis byung zhe na /
translated: By what do they arise?

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “always,” etc.

analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams ni thugs rje chen po'i dbang gis kun nas bslangs pas rtag tu dri ma med pa ste /

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //

original: smon lam grub pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam grub pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //

original: dgag pa med pa'i chos nyid can ni 'gag pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dgag pa med pa'i chos nyid can ni 'gag pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Having the nature of unobstructed reality is having the nature of non-cessation.

original: mtha' yas par khyab pa ni khyab par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas par khyab pa ni khyab par gyur pa'o //
translated: Infinitely pervasive is being all-pervading.

original: thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: The nature of great compassion is buddhahood.

original: rtag tu ni mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni mtha' med pa'o //
translated: Always is endless.

original: rnam par snang ba ni gsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang ba ni gsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Illumination is being manifest.

original: gang zhig gis she na /
analyzed: gang zhig gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: tshad med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshad med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The line immeasurable and so forth is stated.

original: tshad med pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: tshad med pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The immeasurable are the Hearers, Solitary Realizers, and Bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams pas kyang dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams pas kyang dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: They are also immeasurable.

original: shin tu rtogs pa ni 'bras bu mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa ni 'bras bu mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The very realized is the ultimate fruit.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang @70b ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang @70b ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The state of the Well-Gone is complete nirvana.

original: der gshegs par ston kyang ngo //
analyzed: der gshegs par ston kyang ngo //
translated: It is taught that one goes there.

original: de dag kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'gag par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gag par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The line they do not cease is stated.

original: gang gi phyir de'i snying rje chen po'i rgyus mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i snying rje chen po'i rgyus mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because of their great compassion, they do not become phenomena of nirvana.

original: de bas na mi 'gag pa'i chos can nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na mi 'gag pa'i chos can nyid do //
translated: Therefore, they are phenomena that do not cease.

original: de nyid kyi na ae ma'o shin tu bzang ba'i chos nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dis mngon par gsol ba 'debs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi na ae ma'o shin tu bzang ba'i chos nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dis mngon par gsol ba 'debs pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this is the statement of the supplication, Ema! The very excellent reality! and so forth.

original: dam tshig gsum ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: dam tshig gsum ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: The three commitments are the nature of the three bodies.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i dngos grub kyi bdag nyid dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i dngos grub kyi bdag nyid dang ldan pas /
translated: Since he is endowed with the nature of the powers that are the cause of that,

analyzed: mchog sbyin dngos grub rab mchog stsol bas bdag la stsol cig pa'o //
translated: he is the bestower of the supreme gift, the bestower of the highest power, and he should bestow it on me.

original: mchog sbyin rnams kyi nang na go 'phang dam pa mchog brnyes pa ni sbyin pa'i mchog gi gtsor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mchog sbyin rnams kyi nang na go 'phang dam pa mchog brnyes pa ni sbyin pa'i mchog gi gtsor gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who has attained the highest, most excellent state among the bestowers of the supreme gift is the foremost of the bestowers of the supreme gift.

original: rtag tu ni lus la med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni lus la med pa'o //
translated: Always means in the body.

original: dus gsum na dus rnam pa gsum gyi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum na dus rnam pa gsum gyi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: In the three times, at the end of the three times.

original: sgrib pa med pa ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Without obstruction means free from all obstructions.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar sdud pa'i sngon du 'gro bas bstod pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar sdud pa'i sngon du 'gro bas bstod pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan to //
translated: This is the praise of the greatness of the essence, preceded by the summary.

original: lan cig tsam brjod kyang sangs rgyas su 'grub par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: lan cig tsam brjod kyang sangs rgyas su 'grub par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Even by merely reciting it once, one will attain buddhahood,

original: bag chags kyi stobs bskyed cing brtson pa rnams la nges par 'gyur bar dgongs so ;
analyzed: bag chags kyi stobs bskyed cing brtson pa rnams la nges par 'gyur bar dgongs so ;
translated: it is intended that it will certainly be so for those who generate the power of habitual tendencies and strive.

original: / sangs rgyas kun ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas kun ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: All buddhas are Vajrasattva, Vairochana, and so on.

original: de rnams dang bdag nyid sbyor ba ni de dang gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang bdag nyid sbyor ba ni de dang gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Their union with oneself is non-duality with them.

original: dam tshig gsum gyis ni sku gsum gyis so //
analyzed: dam tshig gsum gyis ni sku gsum gyis so //
translated: By the three commitments is by the three bodies.

original: sku ni lta bas mi mngon pa //
analyzed: sku ni lta bas mi mngon pa //
translated: The body is not visible to the sight.

original: zhes bya ba ni sku mthong na mi mthun pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku mthong na mi mthun pa med pa'o //
translated: This means that when the body is seen, there is no disagreement.

original: mchog rnams kun sbyin pa ni rang nyid bstan pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: mchog rnams kun sbyin pa ni rang nyid bstan pa grub pa'o //
translated: The bestowal of all boons is the accomplishment of one's own teaching.

original: de nas de'i zhes bya ba ni bstod pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i zhes bya ba ni bstod pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Then, his is the king of praises.

original: bsgrub pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang gis bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang gis bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment is what is accomplished.

original: shin tu brtags pa yi zhes bya ba ni mchog tu rjes su 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu brtags pa yi zhes bya ba ni mchog tu rjes su 'brel pa ste /
translated: Well-investigated is supremely connected.

original: gang gis sku gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa gang yin pa 'di nyid grub pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis sku gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa gang yin pa 'di nyid grub pa'o //
translated: Whatever is attained by the result of the nature of the three bodies is just this accomplishment.

original: dngos grub ni shin tu mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub ni shin tu mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: Siddhi is the supreme perfection.

original: rdo rje se gol gtogs pa yis //
analyzed: rdo rje se gol gtogs pa yis //
translated: By snapping the fingers with the vajra.

original: zhes pa ni lag pa g-yas kyis rdo rje se gol dang // g-yon gyis se gol dang / gnyi ga'i se gol dang / thal mo lan gsum zhes pa ni g-yas dang g-yon gnyi @71a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lag pa g-yas kyis rdo rje se gol dang // g-yon gyis se gol dang / gnyi ga'i se gol dang / thal mo lan gsum zhes pa ni g-yas dang g-yon gnyi @71a * //
translated: The right hand is the vajra-clapping, the left hand is the clapping of the left hand, the both hands is the clapping of both hands, and the palms is the clapping of the palms three times with both hands.

original: ga'i ste / ji lta ba'i se gol gsum mo //
analyzed: ga'i ste / ji lta ba'i se gol gsum mo //
translated: The as it is is the three clappings of the right and left hands.

original: dbang po gang dang gang lam 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang po gang dang gang lam 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba la sogs pa'i spyod yul la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba la sogs pa'i spyod yul la 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the engagement in the domain of seeing and so forth.

original: de dang de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni de dang de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de dang de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni de dang de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin du'o //
translated: The nature of that and that is the intrinsic nature of that and that.

original: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor zhing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor zhing //
translated: The union with all buddhas

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i nga rgyal du bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i nga rgyal du bsgom pa'o //
translated: is the cultivation of the pride of one's deity.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni sha da dza ko ha la sogs pa'i glu'o //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni sha da dza ko ha la sogs pa'i glu'o //
translated: The passion is the song of Śāḍhujaṅgha and so forth.

original: sha da pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sha da pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Śāḍhu and so forth

original: tsoksha panytsa ma la sogs pa'i glu blang ba'o //
analyzed: tsoksha panytsa ma la sogs pa'i glu blang ba'o //
translated: is the singing of the song of Cakrapañcā and so forth.

original: bzlas par bya zhes bya ba ni gdon pa'o //
analyzed: bzlas par bya zhes bya ba ni gdon pa'o //
translated: The recitation is the chanting.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: go rims snga mas rang gi lha'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas /
analyzed: go rims snga mas rang gi lha'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams rang gi lus kyi nang du ji lta ba bzhin du bsgoms la /

analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas spyod lam thams cad du dngos po thams cad bdag nyid kyi gzugs su lhag par mos la /
translated: Endowed with the yoga of equipoise, one should imagine all things as one’s own form in all activities.

original: sha da pa la sogs pa'i glu rnams dang / bstod pa'i rgyal po brjod na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha da pa la sogs pa'i glu rnams dang / bstod pa'i rgyal po brjod na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sings the songs of Śāḍā and so forth, and recites the king of praises, one will be successful.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: “All oneself” is Vairocana.

original: dam tshig gsum la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gsum la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The three commitments” and so forth are Vairocana and so forth.

original: rtog pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas 'gro ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas 'gro ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: “All concepts” are the path of the buddhas.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to tame sentient beings who are angry and so forth,

translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the Bhagavān’s nature as an emanation body, in order to teach the encouragement of Heruka, he said, “In the past, etc.”

analyzed: khro ba zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'o //

original: gtum pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gtum pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //

original: gdug pa shin tu rno bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gdug pa shin tu rno bar gyur pa'o //

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “With the connection of traces” is

analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: the transformation of the result that is in accordance with the cause.

analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi zhes pa ni shes rab dang snying rje'i rgyu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Wisdom and method” is having the cause of wisdom and compassion.

original: khro bo ni khro bo nyid du'o //
analyzed: khro bo ni khro bo nyid du'o //
translated: “Wrathful” is wrathful itself.

original: de ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: chos rnams sgyu ma dang 'dra bar thugs su chud pas sems can gdug pa rnams la /
analyzed: chos rnams sgyu ma dang 'dra bar thugs su chud pas sems can gdug pa rnams la /
translated: By realizing that phenomena are like illusions, for wicked sentient beings

original: thugs rje nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: thugs rje nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: compassion is placed nearby.

original: de rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As is said:

analyzed: rdo rje chen po he ru ka //

analyzed: gang gis na 'di khro bos chad pas gcod par byed ce na /

original: khro bo'i tshul 'chang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khro bo'i tshul 'chang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: khros pa ni drang srong rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: khros pa ni drang srong rnams kyi'o //
translated: Wrath is that of the sages.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /

original: khro bo'i tshul ni gnas pa ste ;
analyzed: khro bo'i tshul ni gnas pa ste ;
translated: The appearance of wrath is the state.

analyzed: tshul la gnas pas na tshul 'chang ba ste /

analyzed: tshul tsam la gnas pa'i khro bos kyang 'jig rten gsum dag bsreg par nus na /

analyzed: de dbugs phyung ba dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //

analyzed: phyung ba zhes bya ba ni nges par bskyed pa'o //

original: des na rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: des na rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, of various forms,

analyzed: zhal ba zhi dang ldan pas rnam par bsgyur ba'o //

original: des phab nas zhes pa ni dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: des phab nas zhes pa ni dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: Having brought them down,

original: grib ma zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: grib ma zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: he is the shadow, that is, the dakini.

original: thams cad rdo rje mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: thams cad rdo rje mnyam sbyor ba //

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo thams cad du mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo thams cad du mnyam par sbyor ba'o //

analyzed: des mkha' 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor 'bar ba'o //
translated: By that, the mandala of the dakinis blazes.

original: des ci zhig mdzad ce na /
analyzed: des ci zhig mdzad ce na /
translated: What does he do by that?

original: shin tu gdug cing ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: shin tu gdug cing ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He says, “very fierce,” and so on.

original: rdo rje 'dod khro zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang thabs kyi khro bo'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dod khro zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang thabs kyi khro bo'o //
translated: The vajra desire wrathful one is the wrathful one of wisdom and method.

original: rtag pa bla med thams cad kyis //
analyzed: rtag pa bla med thams cad kyis //
translated: All the supreme, eternal

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i sprul pa thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i sprul pa thams cad kyis so //

translated: Now, in order to teach the Bhagavān as the nature of the gnosis of equality, the nature of the saṃbhogakāya, and in order to guide sentient beings who engage in delusion, the consoling Padma Garjī🔽

original: bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir /

original: 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @72a * //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @72a * //
translated: “In the past, ” and so on.

original: te ; log par lta ba la gnas pa ni med par lta ba la mngon par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: te ; log par lta ba la gnas pa ni med par lta ba la mngon par zhugs pa'o //

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //

original: byang chub sems ni rnam spyang phyir //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni rnam spyang phyir //

analyzed: zhes pa ni log par lta ba rab tu spong ba sngon du 'gro bas sems can rnams kyi yang dag pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means in order to generate the correct gnosis of sentient beings, preceded by the abandonment of wrong views.

original: padmo chags par sbyor bas ni //
analyzed: padmo chags par sbyor bas ni //

original: zhes pas ni thugs rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ni thugs rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'o //

original: rdo rje chos su gnas par gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje chos su gnas par gyur //
translated: abides as Vajradharma.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is stated.

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pas bzhugs pa'o //

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /

original: ji ltar padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

original: rdo rje chos su gnas par gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje chos su gnas par gyur // zhes bya ba la /

original: la la dag ni rdo rje chos kyi gzugs su yongs su gyur nas /
analyzed: la la dag ni rdo rje chos kyi gzugs su yongs su gyur nas /

analyzed: de nas padma gar gyi dbang phyug tu skyes pa yin no zhes zer ro //

original: 'dod chags thams cad dag pas na //
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad dag pas na //

original: zhes bya ba ni thugs rje'i 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thugs rje'i 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ste /

translated: And by that very fact, the color of this Bhagavat is like a lotus.🔽By various means of conversion,🔽he has various faces through possessing the dance steps of Lāsya and so on.

original: sna tshogs pa ni gdul bar mos //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni gdul bar mos //

analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par gzigs pa la sogs pa'i sprul pa dang / 'dul bar mdzad pas na 'dul ba ste /

original: lta ba la spyod pa'i gdul bya rnam pa sna tshogs 'dul bas na /
analyzed: lta ba la spyod pa'i gdul bya rnam pa sna tshogs 'dul bas na /

analyzed: sna tshogs pa 'dul bar mos pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //

original: kun tu spyan ras gzigs pa ni /
analyzed: kun tu spyan ras gzigs pa ni /

analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyan ras kyis gzigs pa'o //

original: dbang phyug ni de la dbang thob ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni de la dbang thob ba'o //

original: padmo sgyu ma mnyam sbyor ba'i //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: padmo sgyu ma mnyam sbyor ba'i // zhes pa ni /

original: rtog pa bla na med ces bya ba ni /

analyzed: ngo mthon ni mngon sum du'o //

original: zhes pa ni nus mthu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nus mthu'o //

analyzed: dgra cha lnga ni 'khrul 'khor gyis 'phangs pa la sogs pa ste 'og nas 'chad do //

original: de rnams kyis 'thab pas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyis 'thab pas na /
translated: Because of the struggle with them,

original: dgra cha lnga yis brgal ba'o //
analyzed: dgra cha lnga yis brgal ba'o //

original: lha mo bhi ma zhes bya ba ni dka' thub zlog ma'o //
analyzed: lha mo bhi ma zhes bya ba ni dka' thub zlog ma'o //

analyzed: mi'i dbang phyug ma zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang / dbang phyug ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The word “lord of men” refers to craving and to the lord of the gods.

original: rdo rje 'dzin zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The word “vajra-holder” refers to Vajrasattva.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: The word “awakening” refers to the nature of awakening.

analyzed: sgrub par byed ces bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud la bskyed pa'o //
translated: The word “accomplish” refers to generating it in the mind-streams of sentient beings.

analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub ni zhi ba'i chos nyid thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The enlightenment of the Buddha is the nature of the realization of the reality of peace.

original: de las bskyed pa ni rnam par snang mdzad yin te /
analyzed: de las bskyed pa ni rnam par snang mdzad yin te /
translated: The generation from that is Vairochana.

original: de rab tu bcom pa ni drag po'i sbyor bas sems can rnams rnam par gnon pa ste /
analyzed: de rab tu bcom pa ni drag po'i sbyor bas sems can rnams rnam par gnon pa ste /

analyzed: rang gi rnal 'byor ni drag po'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: One's own yoga is the nature of the application of wrath.

original: rgyas 'debs pa ni brtson 'grus kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas 'debs pa ni brtson 'grus kyi sbyor ba'o //

original: rtog pa bla na med pa thams cad ni rigs thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: rtog pa bla na med pa thams cad ni rigs thams cad kyi'o //

analyzed: gtam gyi sbyor bas ni phyag rgya shes pa'i rtog pa'i 'grel pa ste /
translated: The application of speech is the commentary on the concept of the knowledge of the seal.

original: rtog pa lnga pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rtog pa lnga pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the fifth chapter.

original: // / da ni ji skad bshad pa bzhin bsgom pas dkyil 'khor du dam tshig gsum thob par gyur na /
analyzed: // / da ni ji skad bshad pa bzhin bsgom pas dkyil 'khor du dam tshig gsum thob par gyur na /
translated: Now, if one has attained the three commitments in the mandala by meditating in accordance with the explanation,

analyzed: 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir phyag mtshan dang / phyag rgyal sogs cho gas 'dir bsgrub par bya ba yin pas /
translated: in order to demonstrate the accomplishment, the signs of accomplishment, and so forth, one should accomplish them here by the rite of the seal and so forth.

translated: In order to teach that the Bhagavān Vajrasattva exists in the manner of the maṇḍala of the assembly, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then, moreover,” and so forth.

analyzed: rnam kun sna tshogs ni kun du sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyi lha mos nye bar mtshon pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid dam pas na mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: That itself is the highest, that is, the supreme,

original: bla na med pa'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i rgyur gyur pas so //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i rgyur gyur pas so //
translated: because it is the cause of Vajrasattva, the nature of unsurpassed bliss and mental satisfaction.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union of all buddhas🔽is the supreme bliss of the dakini’s illusion,

original: mkha' 'gro sgyu ma bde ba'i mchog / gsang ba la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i srid pa gsum du rtag tu gnas nas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro sgyu ma bde ba'i mchog / gsang ba la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i srid pa gsum du rtag tu gnas nas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: which is to be accomplished, always abiding in the three worlds, which is superior to the secret, and so forth.

original: dpal ni dpal lha mo'i rnal 'byor can ni bud med rnams te /
analyzed: dpal ni dpal lha mo'i rnal 'byor can ni bud med rnams te /
translated: The glorious ones are the women who have the yoga of the goddess of glory.

original: de yod pas na dpal ldan te /
analyzed: de yod pas na dpal ldan te /
translated: Because they exist, they are glorious.

original: kun nas yongs su bskor zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: kun nas yongs su bskor zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning of “completely surrounded” is explained.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos po ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos po ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of all buddhas is the nature of all buddhas.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to “having become the essence of that. ”

original: rdo rje sems dpa' 'byung ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' 'byung ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The arising of Vajrasattva is having the meditative stabilization of Vajrasattva.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: “ Bliss” is a special activity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid can ni rig pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid can ni rig pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa ste /
translated: The nature of the Tathagata is the king of knowledge and so forth.

original: des sbras pa'o //
analyzed: des sbras pa'o //
translated: It is decorated by that.

original: dri ni byug pa'o //
analyzed: dri ni byug pa'o //
translated: “ Scent” is anointing.

original: srid pa gsum zhes pa ni khang pa sum rtseg go //
analyzed: srid pa gsum zhes pa ni khang pa sum rtseg go //
translated: The three worlds is a three-storied house.

original: skyed mos tshal ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rang gi skyed mos tshal lo //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rang gi skyed mos tshal lo //
translated: The pleasure grove is one’s own pleasure grove as will be explained below.

original: 'jam zhing zhes pa ni shin tu mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: 'jam zhing zhes pa ni shin tu mnyam pa ste /
translated: “ Smooth” is very even.

original: stan nang tshangs can la bya'o zhes man ngag las bshad do //
analyzed: stan nang tshangs can la bya'o zhes man ngag las bshad do //
translated: It is explained in the esoteric instructions that it is a cushion with a filling.

original: sna tshogs pa padmo ni gang la padma rnam pa sna tshogs pa bris pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa padmo ni gang la padma rnam pa sna tshogs pa bris pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The “lotus of variety” is that on which various kinds of lotuses are drawn.

original: g-yogs pa ni des dgab pa'o //
analyzed: g-yogs pa ni des dgab pa'o //
translated: “Covered” means covered by that.

original: thams cad dag pa'i gdan zhes pa ni bdag po'i gdan no //
analyzed: thams cad dag pa'i gdan zhes pa ni bdag po'i gdan no //
translated: “Seat of all purities” is the lord’s seat.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: “The union of all buddhas”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor la sbyor ba'o //
translated: the union with the maṇḍala of union.

original: de la dbang thob pas na dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: de la dbang thob pas na dbang phyug ste /
translated: Since one has attained mastery there, one is the lord,

original: des rnam par 'phrul pas so //
analyzed: des rnam par 'phrul pas so //
translated: and one emanates by that.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i lha ni rdo rje sems dpa'i lha ste lha zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'am rol bas na lha ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i lha ni rdo rje sems dpa'i lha ste lha zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'am rol bas na lha ste /
translated: The “deity of Vajrasattva” is the deity of Vajrasattva. “Deity” means manifest or playing,

original: bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as the supreme bliss, and so on.

original: de na zhes pa ni gdan no //
analyzed: de na zhes pa ni gdan no //
translated: “There” is the seat.

original: rnam par 'phrul bar mdzad ces pa ni gar byed cing bdag gang 'byung ba gang la ston @74a * //
analyzed: rnam par 'phrul bar mdzad ces pa ni gar byed cing bdag gang 'byung ba gang la ston @74a * //
translated: “Emanating” means dancing and manifesting to oneself.

original: pa'o // stan de dag ni zhes pa ni thams cad dag pa'i gdan no //
analyzed: pa'o // stan de dag ni zhes pa ni thams cad dag pa'i gdan no //
translated: “Those seats” are the seats of all purities.

original: thams cad la zhes pa ni kun la'o //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes pa ni kun la'o //
translated: “Everywhere” means everywhere.

original: ji ltar gnas pa zhes pa ni gnas gang dang gang yin pa dang / phyogs gang dang gang yin par gzhag pa ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa zhes pa ni gnas gang dang gang yin pa dang / phyogs gang dang gang yin par gzhag pa ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin te /
translated: As to in whatever way they are situated, whatever the place and whatever the direction in which they are situated, that is in whatever way they are situated.

original: de la ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa ni ji ltar bdag nyid gnas phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa ni ji ltar bdag nyid gnas phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: As to in whatever way they are, they are in whatever way they are situated, in terms of the characteristics of the directions and intermediate directions.

original: ji ltar zhes pa ni bdag po'i stan ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa ni bdag po'i stan ji lta ba'o //
translated: As to just as, it is just as the lord's seat.

original: dgod pa ni der gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: dgod pa ni der gzhag pa ste /
translated: As to arrayed, they are placed there.

original: sna tshogs padma'i ras kyis g-yogs pa de bzhin du dkyil 'khor thams cad du lha mo thams cad la yang de las chung ba'i stan bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma'i ras kyis g-yogs pa de bzhin du dkyil 'khor thams cad du lha mo thams cad la yang de las chung ba'i stan bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as the variegated lotus cloth is spread out, so also in all the maṇḍalas, all the goddesses should have seats smaller than that.

original: gzhan yang sna tshogs padma'i gsang ba las byung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sna tshogs padma'i gsang ba las byung ba ste /
translated: Moreover, arisen from the secret of the variegated lotus

original: 'dab ma brgyad yod pas na sna tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad yod pas na sna tshogs pa yin la /
translated: means that it is variegated because it has eight petals.

original: de nyid ras kyis g-yogs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ras kyis g-yogs pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also covered with cloth,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis g-yogs pas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis g-yogs pas so //
translated: because it is covered with a moon maṇḍala, which is the nature of bodhicitta.

original: 'di lta bu ni thams cad dag pa'i gdan te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni thams cad dag pa'i gdan te /
translated: This is the seat of the complete purification of all.

original: gang du bdag po rnams lha mo rnams dang rnam par rol pa na phyi rol tu 'di ltar rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: gang du bdag po rnams lha mo rnams dang rnam par rol pa na phyi rol tu 'di ltar rtog pa yin te /
translated: When the lords sport with the goddesses, they imagine it to be like this externally.

original: de rnams kyi de yang rtog pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi de yang rtog pa tsam ste /
translated: That of them is merely imagination,

original: lha mo rnams dang gnyis kyi bar gyi mchog dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ming yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha mo rnams dang gnyis kyi bar gyi mchog dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ming yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the supreme of the two, the goddesses and the lords, is named after Vajrasattva, etc.

original: gru bzhi pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi bye brag yin no //
translated: The square, etc. , are the distinctions of the external mandala.

original: nang gi yang /
analyzed: nang gi yang /
translated: The internal is also

original: kun tu sna tshogs skal bzang po //
analyzed: kun tu sna tshogs skal bzang po //
translated: the universal, the various, the fortunate,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad do //🔽sgo srung dang ni ldan par bya //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad do // sgo srung dang ni ldan par bya //
translated: etc.🔽It is endowed with the gatekeepers

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sgo'o //
translated: means the gates are consecrated with Vajra Hook, etc.

original: de nyid kyis na rta gdong la sogs pa'i sgo srung bzhi dgod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rta gdong la sogs pa'i sgo srung bzhi dgod pa yin no //
translated: By that very fact, the four gatekeepers, Hayagrīva, etc. , are placed.

original: rang gi lha dang ldan pa'i zhes pa ni lugs ma la sogs pa'i rang gi lha'i cod pan la sogs pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha dang ldan pa'i zhes pa ni lugs ma la sogs pa'i rang gi lha'i cod pan la sogs pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with one's deity means adorned with the diadem, etc. of one's deity, such as a statue, etc.

original: bud med dag ni legs par grub //
analyzed: bud med dag ni legs par grub //
translated: Women are well-accomplished.

original: ces bya ba ni bud med la rang gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bud med la rang gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: This means that women are adorned with their own ornaments.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du bris la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du bris la /
translated: Having drawn the mandala as it is,

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ste /
translated: in the center of the inner mandala, one should abide with devotion to oneself as Vajrasattva,

original: lag pa g-yas pa na rdo rje bstod de 'dzin pa /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa na rdo rje bstod de 'dzin pa /
translated: holding a vajra in the right hand,

original: g-yon 'gying bag gis dril bu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yon 'gying bag gis dril bu 'dzin pa /
translated: holding a bell with a graceful left [hand],

original: yang g-yas dang g-yon dag na mda' gzhu 'dren par bdag @74b nyid lhag par mos par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: yang g-yas dang g-yon dag na mda' gzhu 'dren par bdag @74b nyid lhag par mos par gnas par bya'o //
translated: and drawing a bow and arrow with the right and left [hands] respectively.

original: stan de nyid kyi shar phyogs kyi 'dab ma la bde ba'i mchog gi rnal 'byor can gyi bud med g-yon 'gying bag gis gzhu 'dzin pa g-yas kyis mda' 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: stan de nyid kyi shar phyogs kyi 'dab ma la bde ba'i mchog gi rnal 'byor can gyi bud med g-yon 'gying bag gis gzhu 'dzin pa g-yas kyis mda' 'dren pa'o //
translated: On the petal in the east of that seat, one should abide with devotion to oneself as Vajrarāga, with the yoga of supreme bliss, a woman holding a bow with a graceful left [hand], drawing an arrow with the right [hand].

original: lho phyogs kyi 'dab ma la aa ho su kha'i rnal 'byor can g-yas kyis bdag po la 'khyud pas gnas pa /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi 'dab ma la aa ho su kha'i rnal 'byor can g-yas kyis bdag po la 'khyud pas gnas pa /
translated: On the petal in the south, the one with the yoga of Aho Sukha, with the right [hand] embracing the Lord,

original: g-yon 'gying bas bha ga dang ling ga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon 'gying bas bha ga dang ling ga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and with the left [hand] in a swaying manner holding the bhaga and linga.

original: nub phyogs kyi 'dab ma la sgrol ma'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa g-yas kyis sna tshogs rdo rje 'dzin pa /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi 'dab ma la sgrol ma'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa g-yas kyis sna tshogs rdo rje 'dzin pa /
translated: On the petal in the west, the one endowed with the yoga of Tara, with the right [hand] holding a vajra cross,

original: g-yon 'gying bas se ral kha'i tshul du bstan pas rdo rje kha tv'am ga dang bcas pa'i ka p'a la thogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon 'gying bas se ral kha'i tshul du bstan pas rdo rje kha tv'am ga dang bcas pa'i ka p'a la thogs pa'o //
translated: and with the left [hand] in a swaying manner holding a skull-cup with a vajra khaṭvāṅga.

original: byang gi phyogs kyi 'dab ma la sha shi'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa lag pa g-yas pas bdag po la dga' bas 'khyud pa /
analyzed: byang gi phyogs kyi 'dab ma la sha shi'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa lag pa g-yas pas bdag po la dga' bas 'khyud pa /
translated: On the petal in the north, the one endowed with the yoga of Śaśi, with the right [hand] embracing the Lord with joy,

original: g-yon pa 'gying bas ka p'a la sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa 'gying bas ka p'a la sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs 'dzin pa /
translated: and with the left [hand] in a swaying manner holding a skull-cup with the form of a Buddha.

original: mdog dkar po 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: mdog dkar po 'chang ba'o //
translated: One should assume the white color.

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi shar la sogs pa'i re'u cha rnams la sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / khams gsum las rgyal ba dang / 'dod pa thams cad kyi lcug ma'i gzugs can rnams rim bzhin du g-yon na rang gi phyag mtshan 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi shar la sogs pa'i re'u cha rnams la sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / khams gsum las rgyal ba dang / 'dod pa thams cad kyi lcug ma'i gzugs can rnams rim bzhin du g-yon na rang gi phyag mtshan 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the inner maṇḍala, in the squares beginning with the east, one should draw the enlightenment of the buddhas, the turning of the wheel of Dharma, the conquest of the three worlds, and the forms of the creepers of all desires, holding their own emblems in the left hand, in order.

original: de bzhin du shar lho la sogs pa'i re'u cha la rta gdong la sogs pa'i gzugs can bzhi pa'o //🔽de'i phyi rol gyi re'u mig rdo rje thig gi nang gi mtshams rnams su gling bu la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar lho la sogs pa'i re'u cha la rta gdong la sogs pa'i gzugs can bzhi pa'o // de'i phyi rol gyi re'u mig rdo rje thig gi nang gi mtshams rnams su gling bu la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: In the squares beginning with the southeast, one should draw the four forms of Hayagrīva, and so on.🔽Outside of that, in the squares inside the vajra line, in the intermediate directions, one should draw the forms of the flute, and so on, in the same way.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams rnams su me tog ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams rnams su me tog ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ma gtogs so //
translated: In the same way, in the intermediate directions of the outer maṇḍala, one should draw the yoginīs beginning with Puṣpā, and so on, except for the yoginīs beginning with Māyā.

original: shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams su lcags kyu dang / zhags pa dang / lcags sgrog dang / dril bu 'dzin pa rnams dgod do //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams su lcags kyu dang / zhags pa dang / lcags sgrog dang / dril bu 'dzin pa rnams dgod do //
translated: One should place the hook, the noose, the chain, and the bell in the eastern and other directions.

original: bde mchog la sogs pa bzhi'i gdan ni sna tshogs padma bya'o //
analyzed: bde mchog la sogs pa bzhi'i gdan ni sna tshogs padma bya'o //
translated: The seats of the four, such as Cakrasaṃvara, should be made of variegated lotuses.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku dang ldan par dgod do //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku dang ldan par dgod do //
translated: In the center of the Vairocana maṇḍala, one should place the Vairocana form with the dharmacakra mudrā.

original: gdan de nyid kyi shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / khar gsil dang / dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam gyi phyag rgya rnams rim pas dgod do //🔽shar la sogs pa'i re'u cha rnams la sangs @75a * //
analyzed: gdan de nyid kyi shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / khar gsil dang / dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam gyi phyag rgya rnams rim pas dgod do // shar la sogs pa'i re'u cha rnams la sangs @75a * //
translated: On the petals of the same seat in the east and so forth, one should place the mudrās of the alms bowl, Dharma robes, water strainer, and the book of the sublime Dharma.

original: rgyas kun brjod ma la sogs pa bzhi po 'og nas 'chad pa'i rang gi phyag mtshan 'gying ba dang bcas par 'dzin cing khu tshur g-yon pa lag pa g-yas pas bkab nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas kun brjod ma la sogs pa bzhi po 'og nas 'chad pa'i rang gi phyag mtshan 'gying ba dang bcas par 'dzin cing khu tshur g-yon pa lag pa g-yas pas bkab nas gnas pa'o //
translated: In the eastern and other squares, one should place the four, such as Buddha-vak, holding their own hand implements as explained below, with swaying movements, and standing with the left fist covering the right hand.

original: me la sogs pa'i mtshams su sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub la sogs pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i mtshams su sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub la sogs pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: At the corners beginning with the east, the four such as enlightenment of all buddhas.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du bshad pa'i lha rnams kyi sku dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du bshad pa'i lha rnams kyi sku dgod par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the remaining ones should be arranged with the bodies of the deities explained in the mandala of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i cho ga yis //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i cho ga yis //
translated: By the rite of Vajrasattva,

original: rtog pa thams cad rab tu bsgrub //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad rab tu bsgrub //
translated: all the deities are accomplished.

original: ces gsungs pas so //
analyzed: ces gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: lha de dag thams cad kyang gdan ni sna tshogs padma bya'o //
analyzed: lha de dag thams cad kyang gdan ni sna tshogs padma bya'o //
translated: All those deities should have various lotus seats.

original: de bzhin du he ru ka la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang gdan gyi nges pa rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du he ru ka la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang gdan gyi nges pa rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the certainties of the seats should be understood in the mandalas of Heruka and so forth.

original: he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor du yang nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su he ru ka'i sku zhal bzhi pa /
analyzed: he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor du yang nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su he ru ka'i sku zhal bzhi pa /
translated: In the mandala of Heruka, in the center of the inner mandala, the body of Heruka has four faces.

original: phyag rgya gnyis pa phrag pa g-yon par rdo rje kha tv'am ga dril bu dang bcas pa se ral kha'i tshul du 'dzin pa /

analyzed: lhor rku byed ma g-yon khro bo'i khu tshur gyis snying gar lcags kyu 'dzin pa /
translated: In the south is Stealer, holding an iron hook at her heart with a wrathful left fist,

original: g-yas kyi gung mo'i rtser 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yas kyi gung mo'i rtser 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa 'dzin pa /
